Subsubsection Text: This offering memorandum has been prepared by us solely for use in connection with the proposed Offering described herein and should be used solely for the purposes for which it has been produced. Distribution of this offering memorandum to any person other than the prospective investor and any person retained to advise such prospective investor with respect to the purchase of the New Notes is unauthorized and any disclosure of any of the contents of this offering memorandum without the Issuer’s prior written consent is prohibited. Each prospective investor, by accepting delivery of this offering memorandum, agrees to the foregoing and agrees to not make copies of this offering memorandum or any documents referred to in this offering memorandum. In making an investment decision, prospective investors must rely solely on the information contained in this offering memorandum and their own examination of the Issuer and its subsidiaries and businesses and the terms of the offering of the New Notes, including the merits and risks involved. Neither the Issuer nor any of the Initial Purchasers has authorized any other person to provide different information to any investor or potential investor and the Issuer does not take responsibility for any information that others may give to you. In addition, neither the Issuer, nor any of the Initial Purchasers, nor the Trustee, nor any of their respective representatives, is making any representation to prospective investors regarding the legality of an investment in the New Notes, and prospective investors should not construe anything in this offering memorandum as legal, business or tax advice. Prospective investors should consult their own advisers as to legal, tax, business, financial and related aspects of an investment in the New Notes. Prospective investors must comply with all laws applicable in any jurisdiction in which they buy, offer or sell the New Notes or possess or distribute this offering memorandum; none of the Issuer, the Initial Purchasers, or the Trustee, shall have any responsibility for any of the foregoing legal requirements. See “Transfer Restrictions.” The Issuer is offering the New Notes in reliance on an exemption from registration under the Securities Act for an offer and sale of securities that does not involve a public offering. The New Notes are subject to restrictions on transferability and resale and may not be transferred or resold except as permitted under the Securities Act and applicable securities laws of any other jurisdiction pursuant to registration or exemption therefrom. Prospective purchasers should be aware that they may be required to bear the financial risks of this investment for an indefinite period of time. If you purchase the New Notes, you will be deemed to have made certain acknowledgments, representations and warranties as detailed under “Transfer Restrictions.” This offering memorandum does not constitute an offer or solicitation by anyone in any jurisdiction in which such offer or solicitation is not authorized or to any person to whom it is unlawful to make such offer or solicitation. No action has been, or will be, taken to permit a public offering in any jurisdiction where action would be required for that purpose. Accordingly, the New Notes may not be offered or sold, directly or indirectly, nor may this offering memorandum be distributed, in any jurisdiction except in accordance with the legal requirements applicable in such jurisdiction. The Issuer reserves the right to withdraw this offering at any time. The Issuer is making this offering subject to the terms described in this offering memorandum and the purchase agreement relating to the New Notes entered into between the Issuer and the Initial Purchasers. The Issuer and the Initial Purchasers may reject any offer to purchase the New Notes in whole or in part, sell less than the entire principal amount of the New Notes offered hereby or allocate to any purchaser less than all of the New Notes for which it has subscribed. The Initial Purchasers, the Issuer and certain of their related entities may acquire, for their own accounts, a portion of the New Notes. Interests in the New Notes will be available initially in book-entry form. The Issuer expects that the New Notes sold will be issued in the form of one or more Global Notes. The Global Notes will be deposited with a common depositary for Euroclear and Clearstream and registered in the name of its nominee. Transfers of book-entry interests in the Global Notes will be effected through records maintained by Euroclear and Clearstream, respectively, and their respective participants. The New Notes will not be issued in definitive registered form except under the circumstances described in the section “Book-entry; Delivery and Form.” The information set out in relation to sections of this offering memorandum describing clearing arrangements, including in the sections entitled “Description of the New Notes” and “Book-entry; Delivery and Form,” is subject to any change in or reinterpretation of the rules, regulations and procedures of Euroclear and Clearstream currently in effect. While the Issuer accepts responsibility for accurately summarizing such information, the Issuer accepts no further responsibility in respect of such information. Application will be made to the Authority for the listing of the New Notes on the Official List of the Exchange, and the Issuer intends to submit this offering memorandum to the competent authorities in connection with ----- the listing application. There can be no assurance, however, that the New Notes will be listed on the Official List of the Exchange. In the course of any review by the competent authority, the Issuer may be requested to make changes to the financial and other information included in this offering memorandum in producing listing particulars for such listing. Comments by the competent authority may require significant modification or reformulation of information contained in this offering memorandum or may require the inclusion of additional information. The Issuer may also be required to update the information in this offering memorandum to reflect changes in the Issuer’s business, financial condition or results of operations and prospects. The Issuer cannot guarantee that such applications for admission of the New Notes on the Exchange will be approved and settlement of the New Notes is not conditioned on obtaining this listing.

IN CONNECTION WITH THIS OFFERING, J.P. MORGAN AG (THE “STABILIZING MANAGER”) OR ANY PERSONS ACTING FOR IT MAY OVER-ALLOT NEW NOTES OR EFFECT TRANSACTIONS WITH A VIEW TO SUPPORTING THE MARKET PRICE OF THE NOTES AT A LEVEL HIGHER THAN THAT WHICH MIGHT OTHERWISE PREVAIL FOR A LIMITED PERIOD AFTER THE ISSUE DATE. HOWEVER, THERE IS NO OBLIGATION OF THE STABILIZING MANAGER OR ANY PERSONS ACTING FOR IT TO DO THIS. SUCH STABILIZING, IF COMMENCED, MAY BE DISCONTINUED AT ANY TIME AND MUST BE BROUGHT TO AN END NO LATER THAN THE EARLIER OF 30 DAYS AFTER THE ISSUE DATE OF THE NEW NOTES AND 60 DAYS AFTER THE DATE OF ALLOTMENT OF THE NEW NOTES.

The Offering is being made in the United States in reliance upon an exemption from registration under the Securities Act for an offer and sale of the New Notes and the Guarantees which does not involve a public offering. In making your purchase, you will be deemed to have made certain acknowledgments, representations and agreements. Please see “Transfer Restrictions.” This offering memorandum is being provided (1) to a limited number of U.S. investors that the Issuer reasonably believes to be “qualified institutional buyers” under Rule 144A for informational use solely in connection with their consideration of the purchase of the New Notes and (2) outside the United States to non-U.S. persons pursuant to “offshore transactions” in compliance with Regulation S. The New Notes described in this offering memorandum have not been registered with, recommended by or approved by the SEC, any state securities commission in the United States or any other securities commission or regulatory authority, nor has the SEC or any state securities commission in the United States or any such other securities commission or authority passed upon the accuracy or adequacy of this offering memorandum. Any representation to the contrary is a criminal offense.

_Resale Restrictions_ The distribution of the New Notes in Canada is being made only in the provinces of Ontario, Quebec, Alberta and British Columbia on a private placement basis exempt from the requirement that we prepare and file a prospectus with the securities regulatory authorities in each province where trades of these securities are made. Any resale of the New Notes in Canada must be made under applicable securities laws which may vary depending on the relevant jurisdiction, and which may require resales to be made under available statutory exemptions or under a discretionary exemption granted by the applicable Canadian securities regulatory authority. Purchasers are advised to seek legal advice prior to any resale of the securities. _Representations of Canadian Purchasers_ By purchasing New Notes in Canada and accepting delivery of a purchase confirmation, a purchaser is representing to us and the dealer from whom the purchase confirmation is received that: - the purchaser is entitled under applicable provincial securities laws to purchase the New Notes without the benefit of a prospectus qualified under those securities laws as it is an “accredited investor” as defined under National Instrument 45 106—Prospectus Exemptions or Section 73.3(1) of the Securities Act (Ontario), as applicable; - the purchaser is a “permitted client”as defined in National Instrument 31 103—Registration Requirements, Exemptions and Ongoing Registrant Obligations; ----- - where required by law, the purchaser is purchasing as principal and not as agent; and - the purchaser has reviewed the text above under “—Resale Restrictions.” _Conflicts of Interest_ Canadian purchasers are hereby notified that the Initial Purchasers are relying on the exemption set out in section 3A.3 or 3A.4, if applicable, of National Instrument 33 105—Underwriting Conflicts from having to provide certain conflict of interest disclosure in this offering memorandum. _Statutory Rights of Action_ Securities legislation in certain provinces or territories of Canada may provide a purchaser with remedies for rescission or damages if this offering memorandum (including any amendment thereto) such as this document contains a misrepresentation, provided that the remedies for rescission or damages are exercised by the purchaser within the time limit prescribed by the securities legislation of the purchaser’s province or territory. The purchaser of these securities in Canada should refer to any applicable provisions of the securities legislation of the purchaser’s province or territory for particulars of these rights or consult with a legal advisor. Upon receipt of this offering memorandum, each Canadian purchaser hereby confirms that it has expressly requested that all documents evidencing or relating in any way to the sale of the New Notes described herein (including for greater certainty any purchase confirmation or any notice) be drawn up in the English language only. Par la réception de ce document, chaque investisseur Canadien confirme par les présentes qu’il a _expressément exigé que tous les documents faisant foi ou se rapportant de quelque manière que ce soit à la vente des valeurs mobilières décrites aux présentes (incluant, pour plus de certitude, toute confirmation d’achat ou tout avis) soient rédigés en anglais seulement. Enforcement of Legal Rights_ All of our directors and officers as well as the experts named herein may be located outside of Canada and, as a result, it may not be possible for Canadian purchasers to effect service of process within Canada upon us or those persons. All or a substantial portion of our assets and the assets of those persons may be located outside of Canada and, as a result, it may not be possible to satisfy a judgment against us or those persons in Canada or to enforce a judgment obtained in Canadian courts against us or those persons outside of Canada. _Taxation and Eligibility for Investment_ Canadian purchasers of New Notes should consult their own legal and tax advisors with respect to the tax consequences of an investment in the New Notes in their particular circumstances and about the eligibility of the New Notes for investment by the purchaser under relevant Canadian legislation.

Section Title: NOTICE TO EUROPEAN ECONOMIC AREA INVESTORS
Subsubsection Text: The New Notes are not intended to be offered, sold or otherwise made available to and should not be offered, sold or otherwise made available to any retail investor in the European Economic Area (the “EEA”) or the United Kingdom. For these purposes, a retail investor means a person who is one (or more) of (i) a retail client as defined in point (11) of Article 4(1) of Directive 2014/65/EU (as amended, “MiFID II”), (ii) a customer within the meaning of Directive 2016/97/EU (as amended, the “Insurance Distribution Directive”) where that customer would not qualify as a professional client as defined in point (10) of Article 4(1) of MiFID II, or (iii) not a qualified investor as defined in the Prospectus Regulation. Consequently no key information document required by Regulation (EU) No 1286/2014 (as amended, the “PRIIPs Regulation”) for offering or selling the New Notes or otherwise making them available to retail investors in the EEA or the United Kingdom has been prepared and therefore offering or selling the New Notes or otherwise making them available to any retail investor in the EEA or the United Kingdom may be unlawful under the PRIIPs Regulation. This offering memorandum has been prepared on the basis that any offer of Notes in any Member State of the EEA or the United Kingdom that is subject to Regulation (EU) 2017/1129 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 14 June 2017 (as amended, the “Prospectus Regulation”) will be made pursuant to an exemption under the Prospectus Regulation from the requirement to publish a prospectus for offers of the New Notes. This offering memorandum is not a prospectus for the purposes of the Prospectus Regulation. -----

The New Notes are not intended to be offered, sold or otherwise made available to and should not be offered, sold or otherwise made available to any retail investor in the United Kingdom (the “UK”). For these purposes, a retail investor means a person who is one (or more) of: (i) a retail client, as defined in point (8) of Article 2 of Regulation (EU) No 2017/565 as it forms part of domestic law by virtue of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018 (the “EUWA”); (ii) a customer within the meaning of the provisions of the FSMA and any rules or regulations made under the FSMA to implement Directive (EU) 2016/97, where that customer would not qualify as a professional client, as defined in point (8) of Article 2(1) of Regulation (EU) No 600/2014 as it forms part of domestic law by virtue of the EUWA or (iii) not a qualified investor as defined in Article 2 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1129 as it forms part of domestic law by virtue of the EUWA. Consequently, no key information document required by Regulation (EU) No 1286/2014 as it forms part of domestic law by virtue of the EUWA (the “UK PRIIPs Regulation”) for offering or selling the New Notes or otherwise making them available to retail investors in the UK has been prepared and, therefore, offering or selling the New Notes or otherwise making them available to any retail investor in the UK may be unlawful under the UK PRIIPs Regulation. This offering memorandum has been prepared on the basis that any offer of the New Notes in the UK will be made pursuant to an exemption under Regulation (EU) 2017/1129 as it forms part of domestic law by virtue of the EUWA (the “UK Prospectus Regulation”) from a requirement to publish a prospectus for offers of securities. This offering memorandum is not a prospectus for the purpose of the UK Prospectus Regulation. Notwithstanding the United Kingdom’s departure from the European Union, any references in this offering memorandum to European Union law should be treated as references to such law as applies in England and Wales from time to time including as retained, amended, extended, re-enacted or otherwise given effect on or after 11:00 pm on January 31, 2020. _MiFID II Product Governance_ Solely for the purposes of the product approval process of J.P. Morgan AG (the “Manufacturer”), the target market assessment in respect of the New Notes described in this offering memorandum has led to the conclusion that (i) the target market for such New Notes is eligible counterparties and professional clients only, each as defined in MiFID II and (ii) all channels for distribution of such New Notes to eligible counterparties and professional clients are appropriate. Any person subsequently offering, selling or recommending such New Notes (a “distributor”) should take into consideration the Manufacturer’s target market assessment; however, a distributor subject to MiFID II is responsible for undertaking its own target market assessment in respect of such New Notes (by either adopting or refining the Manufacturer’s target market assessment) and determining appropriate distribution channels.

This offering memorandum, as well as any other material relating to the New Notes which are the subject of the offering of the New Notes contemplated by this offering memorandum, do not constitute an issue prospectus pursuant to article 652a and/or article 1156 of the Swiss Code of Obligations and may not comply with the Directive for Notes of Foreign Borrowers of the Swiss Bankers Association. The New Notes will not be listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange Ltd. or any other Swiss stock exchange or regulated trading facility and, therefore, the documents relating to the New Notes, including, but not limited to, this offering memorandum, do not claim to comply with the disclosure standards of the Swiss Code of Obligations and the listing rules of SIX Swiss Exchange Ltd. and corresponding prospectus schemes annexed to the listing rules of the SIX Swiss Exchange Ltd or the listing rules of any other Swiss stock exchange or regulated trading facility. The New Notes are being offered in Switzerland by way of a private placement (i.e., to a small number of selected investors only), without any public advertisement and only to investors who do not purchase the New Notes with the intention to distribute them to the public. The investors will be individually approached directly from time to time. This offering memorandum, as well as any other material relating to the New Notes, is personal and confidential and does not constitute an offer to any other person. This offering memorandum, as well as any other material relating to the New Notes, may only be used by those investors to whom it has been handed out in connection with the offering described herein and may neither directly or indirectly be distributed or made available to other persons without the Issuer’s express consent. This offering memorandum, as well as any other material relating to the New Notes, may not be used in connection with any other offer and shall in particular not be copied and/or distributed to the public in (or from) Switzerland. -----

This offering memorandum includes forward-looking statements, which are based on our current expectations and projections about future events. All statements other than statements of historical facts included in this offering memorandum including, without limitation, statements regarding our future financial position, risks and uncertainties related to our business, strategy, capital expenditure, projected costs and our plans and objectives for future operations, may be deemed to be forward-looking statements. Words such as “believe,” “expect,” “anticipate,” “may,” “assume,” “plan,” “intend,” “will,” “should,” “estimate,” “risk” and similar expressions or the negatives of these expressions are intended to identify forward-looking statements. By their nature, forward-looking statements involve known and unknown risks and uncertainties because they relate to events and depend on circumstances that may or may not occur in the future. Forward-looking statements are not guarantees of future performance. You should not place undue reliance on these forward-looking statements. In addition any forward-looking statements are made only as of the date of this offering memorandum and we do not intend, and do not assume any obligation, to update forward-looking statements set forth in this offering memorandum. Many factors may cause our results of operations, financial condition, liquidity and the development of the industry in which we compete to differ materially from those expressed or implied by the forward-looking statements contained in this offering memorandum. Factors that could cause such differences in actual results include: - the high level of competition in the markets in which we operate; - the impact of volatile economic conditions on demand for our services and our subscriber base; - our ability to generate strong advertising sales; - our ability to successfully complete acquisitions and the risks associated with those acquisitions; - the possibility of competition authorities delaying or preventing acquisitions; - acceptance of our content by the public; - our dependence on relationships with content owners; - our ability to keep pace with technological changes and evolving industry standards; - the level of governmental regulation applicable to our business operations; - the impact of currency exchange rate fluctuations and the Eurozone debt crisis on our business; - the impact of outbreaks of severe communicable diseases; - legal, political and economic uncertainty surrounding the expected exit of the United Kingdom from the European Union; - the influence of the political, judicial, economic or security environment on our business; - our lack of valid use permits for, or rights to use, parts of our cable network; - our title to use certain parts of our communication network in Slovenia; - our ability to recognize any or all of the adjustments to Last Two Quarter Annualized Run-Rate Adjusted EBITDA; - our ability to implement and maintain effective internal controls; - our ability to increase our subscriber base or subscription fees; - the impact of customer churn; - our ability to market our products and services; - failures in our technology or telecommunications systems; - the risks associated with operating a capital intensive business; - our relationships with third-party providers of hardware, software, satellite services and customer support; - our ability to maintain our reputation and the value associated with our brands; - the possible health risks of antenna sites and the use of mobile telephones; ----- - our ability to attract and retain key personnel; - our ability to maintain positive business relationships with our competitors; - our ability to renew regulatory licenses and permits; - our ability to secure spectrum; - current or future levels of EU regulation of the level of mobile roaming charges; - the continued implementation of political and economic reforms in our countries of operation; - our ability to cope with more extensive regulation; - the impact of changes in labor laws on our business; - our ability to comply with applicable data protection laws and policies; - the impact of legal proceedings on our business; - the extent to which our business operations are protected by intellectual property rights; - our compliance with third-party intellectual property rights; - our ability to cope with increased inflation; - the impact of changes to tax legislation on our business; and - other risks associated with our indebtedness, the offering of the New Notes and our structure as discussed under “Risk Factors.” We disclose important factors that could cause our actual results to differ materially from our expectations in “Risk Factors”and “The Company’s Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results _of Operations.” Other sections of this offering memorandum describe additional factors that could adversely_ affect our business, financial condition or results of operations. Moreover, we operate in a very competitive and rapidly changing environment. New risk factors emerge from time to time and it is not possible for us to predict all such risk factors. We cannot assess the impact of all risk factors on our business or the extent to which any factor, or combination of factors, may cause actual results to differ materially from those contained in any forward-looking statements. Given these risks and uncertainties, you should not place undue reliance on forward-looking statements as a prediction of actual results. -----

Subsection Title: PRESENTATION OF FINANCIAL DATA Historical Financial Data Included In This Offering Memorandum
Subsubsection Text: We have included in this offering memorandum: (i) consolidated financial data of the Company as of and for the year ended December 31, 2020, derived from the Company’s audited consolidated financial statements and the related notes thereto as of and for the year ended December 31, 2020, which were prepared in accordance with IFRS (as defined herein), as adopted by the EU, and are included elsewhere in this offering memorandum (the “2020 Company Audited Financial Statements”), (ii) consolidated financial data of the Company as of and for the year ended December 31, 2019, and the comparative information as of and for the year ended December 31, 2018, derived from its audited consolidated financial statements and the related notes thereto as of and for the year ended December 31, 2019, which were prepared in accordance with IFRS (as defined herein), as adopted by the EU, and are included elsewhere in this offering memorandum (the “2019 Company Audited Financial Statements”and, together with the 2020 Company Audited Financial Statements, the “Company Audited Financial Statements”), and (iii) consolidated financial data of the Company for the three months ended March 31, 2020 and as of and for the three months ended March 31, 2021, derived from Company’s unaudited interim condensed consolidated financial statements and the related notes thereto as of and for the three months ended March 31, 2021, which were prepared in accordance with International Accounting Standards No. 34 Interim Financial Reporting (“IAS 34”), as adopted by the EU, and are included elsewhere in this offering memorandum (the “Company Unaudited Interim Financial Statements”). These Company Unaudited Interim Financial Statements were reissued as a result of correction of a disclosure, as explained in note 3.2. The independent auditors’report on the review of the Company Unaudited Interim Financial Statements contains the following Emphasis of Matter: “We draw attention to the note 2.1 which describes that these condensed consolidated financial statements have been reissued for a reason of correction of disclosure in the note 3.2. Our conclusion is not modified in respect of this matter.” We also present certain unaudited consolidated income statement financial data and other financial data for the Company for the last two quarters ended March 31, 2021, which has been derived by subtracting the applicable unaudited financial data for the nine months ended September 30, 2020 (derived from note 39 in the 2020 Company Audited Financial Statements) from the financial data from the for the year ended December 31, 2020 (derived from the 2020 Company Audited Financial Statements) and adding the applicable unaudited financial data for the three months ended March 31, 2021 (derived from the Company Unaudited Interim Financial Statements). Such data calculated on a historical basis includes financial data of Forthnet consolidated within the Group’s results since November 12, 2020, financial data of Nova Broadcasting Group EOOD (“Nova BG”) consolidated within the Group’s results since January 22, 2021 and financial data of Dan Graf consolidated within the Group’s results since March 10, 2021 (but in each case, not for previous periods). We also present unaudited summary financial data for the twelve months ended March 31, 2021 for certain segments of the Company, which have been derived by subtracting the applicable financial data for the three months ended March 31, 2020 from the financial data for the year ended December 31, 2020 and adding the financial data for the three months ended March 31, 2021. The Company is the direct parent company of the Issuer and the ultimate parent company of the restricted group for the New Notes. Unless otherwise indicated, all historical financial data in respect of United Group presented in this offering memorandum is that of the Company (which includes its consolidated subsidiaries). Accordingly, unless otherwise stated, all references to “we,” “us,” “our,” “Group,” “UG” or “United Group” in respect of historical financial data and unaudited pro forma financial data in this offering memorandum are to the Company (including its subsidiaries on a consolidated basis). -----

Subsection Title: PRESENTATION OF FINANCIAL DATA Historical Financial Data Included In This Offering Memorandum
Subsubsection Text: On July 31, 2018, Slovenia Broadband S.à r.l., a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company, acquired Nova TV d.d. from CME B.V. in the Nova TV Croatia Acquisition. The financial data of Nova TV d.d. has been consolidated in the Company’s financial data as of and from July 31, 2018. On September 4, 2018, United Media S.à r.l., a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company, acquired Direct Media d.o.o. Beograd from Ascanius Netherlands B.V. in the Direct Media/Pink Acquisition. The financial data of Direct Media d.o.o. Beograd have been consolidated in the Company’s financial data as of and from September 4, 2018. On March 3, 2020, Slovenia Broadband S.à r.l., a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company, acquired Tele2 d.o.o. za telekomunikacijske usluge in the Tele2 Croatia Acquisition. The financial data of Tele2 d.o.o. za telekomunikacijske usluge (now trading as Telemach Hrvatska d.o.o. or “Telemach Croatia”) has been consolidated in the Company’s financial data as of and from March 3, 2020. On July 31, 2020, United Group Bulgaria EOOD, a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company, acquired Viva Telecom Bulgaria EOOD in the Vivacom Acquisition. The financial data of Bulgarian Telecommunications Company EAD (trading as “Vivacom”) has been consolidated in the Company’s financial data as of and from July 31, 2020. On November 12, 2020, NewCo United Group Hellas S.à r.l., a wholly-owned indirect subsidiary of the Company, acquired a controlling stake in Forthnet S.A. and its subsidiaries (“Forthnet”) (for details, refer to Note 21.1 to the Company Unaudited Interim Financial Statements). The financial data of Forthnet has been consolidated in the Company’s financial data as of and from November 12, 2020. On January 22, 2021, United Group Bulgaria EOOD, a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company, acquired Nova BG in the Nova Broadcasting Group Acquisition. The financial data of Nova BG, including its provisional purchase price allocation, has been consolidated in the Company’s financial data as of and from January 22, 2021. See Note 23 to the 2020 Company Audited Financial Statements and Note 21 to the Company Unaudited Interim Financial Statements for additional information regarding business combinations. _Adoption of New Accounting Policies_ We have adopted various accounting policies during the financial periods presented in this offering memorandum. With effect as of January 1, 2019, we have adopted IFRS 16 (Leases) and IFRIC 23 (Uncertainty over Income Tax Treatments). For the impact of the adoption of IFRS 16 (Leases) on our financial statements, see Note 4 to the 2019 Company Audited Financial Statements. See “The Company’s _Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations—Key Factors Affecting Our Business and Results of Operations—Implementation of New Accounting Policies and Accounting Updates.”_ As permitted under IFRS, we did not apply a full retrospective approach when adopting these accounting policies and as a result have not restated any historical financial data of the Company (including comparative figures) prior to the date disclosed above. As a result of these changes in accounting policies, our results and financial position may not be directly comparable from period to period. _Company Segment Reporting_ We are a pan regional distribution platform of cable and satellite Pay-TV, broadband internet and telephony services in Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, Bulgaria, Croatia, North Macedonia and Greece. Our business has grown substantially in terms of scale, geographic reach and service offering since 2018 through both organic growth and acquisitions. As a consequence of these changes, our Group-level financial reporting has evolved during the last several years. In order to provide a meaningful analysis of our results of operations during the period under review discussed under “The Company’s Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of _Operations”, in addition to a discussion of our Group-level consolidated results of operations based on IFRS_ measures, we also present a discussion of revenues, UG Adjusted EBITDA and UG Adjusted Capital Expenditure of our Serbia Group, Slovenia Group, Bosnia Group, Montenegro Group and Media Group segments for the years ended December 31, 2018, 2019 and 2020, and the three months ended March 31, 2020 and 2021. We also present a discussion of revenues, UG Adjusted EBITDA and UG Adjusted Capital ----- Expenditure for the three months ended March 31, 2021 of: our Croatia Group, which we added following the completion of the Tele2 Croatia Acquisition (as further described in this offering memorandum); our Bulgaria Group, which we added following the completion of the Vivacom Acquisition (as further described in this offering memorandum); and of our Greece Group, which we added following the completion of the Forthnet Acquisition (as further described in this offering memorandum). Under IFRS 8 “Operating Segments,” we present our segment data in the notes to the annual and interim financial statements. In Note 5 to the Company Unaudited Interim Financial Statements, we disclose the segment results for nine business segments, which are as follows: - Serbia Group. This segment includes the results of cable services in Serbia and DTH operations in Serbia, and North Macedonia, including the results of Ikom (acquired in April 2017). This segment also includes the results of Absolut Solutions, (although these results are not reflected in the statutory consolidated results of the SBB Serbia Group); - Slovenia Group. This segment includes the results of our cable and mobile services and DTH operations in Slovenia; - Bosnia Group. This segment includes the results of our cable and DTH operations in Bosnia and Herzegovina; - Montenegro Group. This segment includes the results of our cable and DTH business in Montenegro; - Bulgaria Group. This segment includes the results of our telecommunications operations in Bulgaria; - Croatia Group. This segment includes the results of our mobile services in Croatia; - Greece Group. This segment includes the results of Forthnet’s telecommunications and media operations in Greece; - Media Group. This segment includes the results of our media and content business in Southeastern Europe including the results of N1 Info, Grand Production, Orlando Kids, Nova TV, Nova M and Nova BH as well as United Media S.à r.l., United Media Network AG, Direct Media, Nova BG and Dan Graf; and - Other segments. This includes our other operating business, Solford Trading Ltd. (which operates NetTV Plus) and Shoppster, and our non-operating holding companies (United Group B.V., Adria Cable B.V., Adria Serbia Holdco B.V. and Slovenia Broadband S.à r.l.). Revenue reported under “Other” is mainly generated by Solford Trading Ltd. which operates Shoppster. Our Media Group segment presents results for Nova BG (acquired on January 22, 2021) and Dan Graf (acquired on March 10, 2021) from the respective date of consolidation with the Group’s results for the three months ended March 31, 2021. While we adopted IFRS 16 with effect from January 1, 2019 at the consolidated Group level, we did not give effect to IFRS 16 in our management accounts and therefore at the segment level until January 1, 2021. In this offering memorandum we have adjusted the figures for the year ended December 31, 2020 to reflect this change in accounting policy at the segment level to enhance comparability. As a result, our UG Adjusted EBITDA, UG Adjusted EBITDA Margin and Adjusted Capital Expenditure for our Serbia Group, Slovenia Group, Bosnia Group, Montenegro Group and Media Group for the years ended December 31, 2018 and 2019 are not comparable with amounts for the year ended December 31, 2020 and the three months ended March 31, 2021. _Capital Expenditure and UG Adjusted Capital Expenditure_ Capital expenditure represents purchases of tangible and intangible assets, consisting primarily of set-top box purchases and other customer capital expenditure, installations (including capitalized labor costs), cable and mobile network build out, upgrades, maintenance and other investments, computer hardware and software. In this offering memorandum, for the years ended December 31, 2018, 2019 and 2020, we have derived capital expenditure (as recognized under IFRS) for the Company and for each of the Company’s business segments from the Company Audited Financial Statements and, for the three months ended March 31, 2020 and 2021, from the Company Unaudited Interim Financial Statements. See “Reconciliation of Certain Financial Data _Presented Herein.”_ UG Adjusted Capital Expenditure represents capital expenditure, as adjusted by intragroup adjustments, the application of IFRS 15 for acquisition costs in SBB Serbia, assets held for sale and overflow between periods. ----- Intragroup adjustments relate to unrealized profit on the intragroup sale of end-user equipment by SBB Serbia. When SBB Serbia sells this equipment to other Group companies in compliance with applicable transfer pricing requirements, it makes an unrealized profit on the sale. These unrealized profits are eliminated for the purposes of preparing our accounts in accordance with IFRS, but are not eliminated for the purpose of our management accounts (which are not prepared in accordance with IFRS). The application of IFRS 15 for acquisition costs in SBB Serbia reflects the additional effect of harmonizing our accounting policy with respect to the capitalization of subscriber acquisition costs for rebinding, upselling and cross-selling (which in the past were not eligible to be capitalized, but under IFRS 15 qualify for capitalization), which were determined subsequent to the preparation of our management accounts. Assets held for sale relate to programming rights acquired by our Media Group segment for other Group segments which were recognized under IFRS as intangible assets and were invoiced to other Group segments after March 31, 2021. Overflow between periods relates to the fact that our management accounts are closed prior to the closing of our accounts prepared in accordance with IFRS. Overflow between periods in any given period reflects the additional capital expenditure incurred between the preparation of our management accounts and our accounts prepared in accordance with IFRS for such period. In this offering memorandum, we present UG Adjusted Capital Expenditure for the Company and for each of the Company’s business segments for the years ended December 31, 2018, 2019 and 2020, and for the three months ended March 31, 2020 and 2021. See “Summary of Company and Group Run-Rate, Vivacom, _Unaudited Pro Forma and Certain Other Financial Data” and “Reconciliation of Certain Financial Data Presented Herein.” A reconciliation between the Company’s capital expenditure and UG Adjusted Capital_ Expenditure for the years ended December 31, 2018, 2019 and 2020, and the three months ended March 31, 2021 is included elsewhere in this offering memorandum, under “Reconciliation of Certain Financial Data _Presented Herein.” In addition, for informational purposes only, we describe our anticipated UG Adjusted_ Capital Expenditure for the year ended December 31, 2021 based on management estimates, which may vary from our actual Group level capital expenditure data when it is prepared in accordance with IFRS. UG Adjusted Capital Expenditure and our future UG Adjusted Capital Expenditure estimates are prepared based on management accounts rather than IFRS. One example of a difference in methodology used in preparing the management account financial data (as compared to IFRS financial data) is that when determining capital expenditure relating to set-top boxes purchased by our group companies, the expenditure is treated as inventory until such set-top box is activated by the end-user, at which time it is treated as a fixed asset. Under IFRS, however, this expenditure is required to be accounted for as a fixed asset from the moment such set-top box is purchased. As a result, when presenting our segment level UG Adjusted Capital Expenditure and our anticipated UG Adjusted Capital Expenditure for the year ended December 31, 2021 in this offering memorandum, we classify our expenditures relating to set-top boxes as inventory until such set-top boxes are activated by the end-user. PricewaterhouseCoopers d.o.o. Zagreb has not audited, reviewed or performed any procedures with respect to UG Adjusted Capital Expenditure included in this offering memorandum, and, accordingly, PricewaterhouseCoopers d.o.o. Zagreb does not express an opinion or any other form of assurance on such information. PricewaterhouseCoopers d.o.o. assumes no responsibility for and denies any association with or responsibility for the Company’s calculation of UG Adjusted Capital Expenditure. _Foreign Exchange Rates_ SBB Serbia, Telemach BH, Telemach Croatia and Vivacom and Nova BG historically have reported their results in Serbian dinar, Bosnian marks, Croatian kune and Bulgarian lev, respectively. Where we have presented financial data for each of SBB Serbia, Telemach BH, Telemach Croatia, Vivacom and Nova BG in this offering memorandum, it is presented in euro rather than Serbian dinar, Bosnian marks, Croatian kune or Bulgarian lev, respectively. Where we have presented financial data for Vivacom or Nova BG in a currency other than the euro, it is presented in Bulgarian lev. The exchange rates used for the financial data of SBB Serbia, Telemach BH and Telemach Croatia presented in this offering memorandum are the following average exchange rates for the relevant period, based on the Serbian and Croatian national banks’ daily middle rate exchange rates on working and non-working days during the period indicated below: - Serbian dinar to euro: RSD 118.2752 per €1.00 for the year ended December 31, 2018, which was the average rate during that period; RSD 117.8595 per €1.00 for the year ended December 31, 2019, which was the ----- average rate during that period; RSD 117.5777 per €1.00 for the year ended December 31, 2020, which was the average rate during that period; RSD 117.5677 per €1.00 for the three months ended March 31, 2020, which was the average rate during that period; and RSD 117.5782 per €1.00 for the three months ended March 31, 2021, which was the average rate during that period. - Croatian kuna to euro: HRK 7.5331 per €1.00 for the year ended December 31, 2020, which was the average rate during that period; HRK 7.5377 per €1.00 for the nine months ended September 30, 2020, which was the average rate during that period; HRK 7.4888 per €1.00 for the three months ended March 31, 2020, which was the average rate during that period; and HRK 7.56724 per €1.00 for the three months ended March 31, 2021, which was the average rate during that period. The financial data of Telemach BH and Vivacom and Nova BG (when presented in euros) presented in this offering memorandum use the following exchange rates: - Bosnian mark to euro: BAM 1.9558 per €1.00, which is the rate at which the Bosnian mark is pegged to the euro. - Bulgarian lev to euro: BGN 1.9558 per €1.00, which is the rate at which the Bulgarian lev is pegged to the euro.

Subsection Title: PRESENTATION OF FINANCIAL DATA Historical Financial Data Included In This Offering Memorandum
Subsubsection Text: We have included in this offering memorandum: (i) consolidated financial data of BTC (as defined under “Certain Definitions”) as of and for the year ended December 31, 2020, derived from its audited consolidated financial statements and the related notes there to as of and for the years ended December 31, 2020, which were prepared in accordance with IFRS (as defined herein) and are included elsewhere in this offering memorandum (the “2020 Vivacom Audited Financial Statements”), (ii) consolidated financial data of BTC as of and for the year ended December 31, 2019, and the comparative information as of and for the year ended December 31, 2018, derived from its audited consolidated financial statements and the related notes there to as of and for the year ended December 31, 2019, which were prepared in accordance with IFRS (as defined herein) and are included elsewhere in this offering memorandum (the “2019 Vivacom Audited Financial Statements” and together with the 2020 Vivacom Audited Financial Statements, the “Vivacom Audited Financial Statements”), and (iii) condensed consolidated interim financial data of BTC for the nine months ended September 30, 2020, derived from its unaudited condensed consolidated interim financial statements and the related notes thereto as of and for the three and nine months ended September 30, 2020, which were prepared in accordance with “IAS 34”, as adopted by the EU, and are included elsewhere in this offering memorandum (the “Vivacom Unaudited Interim Financial Statements”). Certain financial information of BTC as of and for the year ended December 31, 2019 included in this offering memorandum is derived from the unaudited comparative financial information included in the 2020 Vivacom Audited Financial Statements and is presented to reflect restated amounts resulting from the change in the accounting policy related to leases of software, which was implemented in order to align to the treatment and presentation under the accounting policies of Summer Parent S.à r.l. As a result, leased software is presented as “Intangible assets” according to IAS 38—Intangible assets and not as “Right-of-use assets”, by applying IFRS 16—Leases. The corresponding liabilities were reclassified accordingly from “Borrowings and lease liabilities” to “Trade payables”. See Note 2.1.1 to the 2020 Vivacom Audited Financial Statements. The financial information of BTC as of and for the year ended December 31, 2018 included in this offering memorandum was not restated to reflect this change in accounting policy given IFRS 16 was adopted as of January 1, 2019 under the modified retrospective approach, and therefore it may not be comparable with the financial information of BTC as of and for the years ended December 31, 2019 and 2020 included in this offering memorandum. The financial information as of and for the year ended December 31, 2018 included in this offering memorandum is derived from the unaudited comparative financial information included in the 2019 Vivacom Audited Financial Statements as of and is presented to reflect the (i) restated amounts of net cash from operating activities and net cash used in investing activities for the year ended December 31, 2018, which have been restated due to reclassification of 2018 capitalized costs to fulfil and obtain contracts with customers from operating activities, to properly reflect the investing nature of those costs, in the amount of BGN 32.8 million, (ii) restated amounts of capital expenditures for the year ended December 31, 2018, which have ----- been restated to be presented on a consistent basis with the calculation performed for the year ended December 31, 2019 and the nine months ended September 30, 2020, and (iii) restated amounts in the statement of comprehensive income due to a reclassification of other operating expenses, with effect from January 1, 2019, the amount of recognized losses for impairment of financial and contract assets is included under the separate line item “Net impairment losses on financial and contract assets.” Additionally, Vivacom has considered the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic as non-adjusting subsequent events and therefore the 2019 Vivacom Audited Financial Statements do not reflect the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. See Note 4 to the 2020 Vivacom Audited Financial Statements. _Adoption of New Accounting Policies_ Vivacom has adopted various accounting policies during the financial periods presented in this offering memorandum. With effect as of January 1, 2019, Vivacom has adopted IFRS 16 (Leases). As permitted under IFRS, Vivacom did not apply a full retrospective approach when adopting these accounting policies and, as a result, has not restated any historical financial data (including the relevant comparative figures) prior to the implementation of the new accounting policies as of the date mentioned above. As a result of these changes in accounting policies, Vivacom’s results and financial position may not be directly comparable from period to period. _Vivacom Segment Reporting_ We also present a discussion of BTC’s revenues, cost of sales and gross margin for its operating segments for the years ended December 31, 2018 (which were derived from the comparative financial information included in the 2019 Vivacom Audited Financial Statements ), 2019 and 2020. Under IFRS 8 “Operating Segments,”BTC presents its segment data in the notes to the 2020 Vivacom Audited Financial Statements and the Vivacom Unaudited Interim Financial Statements. In Note 26 to the Vivacom Audited Financial Statements and Note 25 to the Vivacom Unaudited Interim Financial Statements, BTC reports operating segment results for three operating segments: - Fixed-line of business: this segment includes the results of voice and data services over the fixed network and Pay-TV (both DTH and IPTV); - Mobile line of business: this operating segment includes the results from mobile services (GSM, UMTS and LTE standards); and - NURTS business: this operating segment includes the results from TV and radio broadcasting, collocation services and maintenance of telecom infrastructure arising from BTC’s subsidiary NURTS Bulgaria EAD and its wholly-owned subsidiary NURTS Digital EAD.

Subsection Title: PRESENTATION OF FINANCIAL DATA Historical Financial Data Included In This Offering Memorandum
Subsubsection Text: We have set forth below a description of the historical (audited and unaudited) financial data included in this offering memorandum.

We present in this offering memorandum unaudited pro forma financial information (the “Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information”), which includes the unaudited pro forma income statement of the Company for the year ended December 31, 2020. The Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information is based on and derived from, and should be read in conjunction with, the Company Audited Financial Statements, the Company Unaudited Interim Financial Statements and the Vivacom Unaudited Interim Financial Statements included elsewhere in this offering memorandum. The Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information gives effect to the (i) Vivacom Acquisition (which completed on August 3, 2020) and (ii) issuance of the Existing 2026 FRNs, Existing 2026 SSNs and Existing 2028 SSNs (the “2020 Notes Financing”), which were partially used to finance the Vivacom Acquisition and, partially, to refinance certain debt facilities existing at the issue date of the Existing 2026 SSNs, Existing 2026 FRNs and Existing 2028 SSNs (the “2020 Notes Issue Date”) (collectively, the “Vivacom Transactions”), as if they had been completed on January 1, 2020. The Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information is based on available information and certain assumptions that we believe are reasonable. The assumptions and estimates underlying the Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information are described in the accompanying notes thereto. The Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information is presented for illustrative purposes only and is not intended to represent or be indicative of the financial results of operations that we would have reported had the Vivacom Transactions actually occurred ----- during the period presented, and the Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information does not purport to project our results of operations for any future period. Neither the assumptions underlying the pro forma adjustments, nor the resulting Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information have been audited or reviewed in accordance with any generally accepted auditing standards. The Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information has not been prepared in accordance with Article 11 of Regulation S-X under the Securities Act, the EU Prospectus Regulation or any generally accepted accounting standards. The Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information has been prepared in accordance with the basis of preparation described below in the footnotes thereto. The Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information is presented in thousands of euros unless otherwise indicated. Vivacom historical financial information is presented in thousands of Bulgarian lev. For the purposes of the Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information, financial information reported in Bulgarian lev has been translated to euros on the basis stated in relevant footnotes to the Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information. The Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information includes unaudited pro forma adjustments that are factually supportable and directly attributable to the Vivacom Transactions. In addition to the Vivacom Acquisition, the Company also: (i) acquired Tele2 d.o.o. za telekomunikacijske usluge (now trading as Telemach Hrvatska d.o.o.) and has consolidated its results from March 2020; (ii) the Company obtained control over Forthnet on November 12, 2020 (for more information, please refer to Note 23 in the Company Audited Financial Statements); (iii) acquired Nova Broadcasting Group and has consolidated its results from January 22, 2021; and (iv) has completed certain other acquisitions in 2021, as described elsewhere in this offering memorandum. The Company Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information does not include adjustments with respect to the acquisitions referred to above. Prospective investors should read the information presented below in conjunction with “Presentation of _Financial Data,” “Capitalization,” “The Company’s Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations,” “Vivacom’s Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations,” the Company Audited Financial Statements (and the related notes_ thereto), the Company Unaudited Interim Financial Statements (and the related notes thereto), the Vivacom Audited Financial Statements (and the related notes thereto) and the Vivacom Unaudited Interim Financial Statements (and the related notes thereto), included elsewhere in this offering memorandum.

Subsection Title: Group Data on a Run-Rate Basis
Subsubsection Text: We also present in this offering memorandum certain financial data of the Group on a run-rate basis, which adjusts certain financial data derived from the Company Audited Financial Statements and the Company Unaudited Interim Financial Statements with (a) the results of Forthnet for the period from October 1, 2020 to November 11, 2020, sourced from its Forthnet’s unaudited management accounts, which has been adjusted for savings in transponder costs already agreed with the supplier and which has been further adjusted to reflect the application of our accounting policies and satellite savings, (b) the results of Nova BG for the period from October 1, 2020 to January 21, 2021, sourced from its unaudited management accounts and which has been aligned in certain aspects to our Group accounting policies, and estimates of additional carriage fees, (c) the last two quarters adjusted EBITDA not yet consolidated into the Group's results for the contribution of the following companies acquired during the period: Dan Graf, Vesnik Telegraf, Net1, N3, D express, Mainstream and Networx, and (d) the last two quarters adjusted EBITDA not yet consolidated into the Group's results for the contribution of Optima Telekom, sourced from its unaudited management accounts. The Group data on a run-rate basis presented in this offering memorandum is based on a number of assumptions made in reliance on the information available to us and management’s judgments based on such information. The assumptions used in estimating the adjustments are inherently uncertain and are subject to a wide variety of significant business, economic, and competitive risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from those presented in this offering memorandum. See “Summary of _Company and Group Run-Rate, Vivacom, Unaudited Pro Forma and Certain Other Financial Data.”_ The Group data on a run-rate basis included in this offering memorandum has been prepared by the Company’s management. The Group data on a run-rate basis is not intended to and does not represent historical or future performance for any period. Such information is the sole responsibility of the Company’s management. PricewaterhouseCoopers d.o.o. Zagreb has not audited, reviewed, examined or compiled, or has applied agreed upon procedures with respect to the Group data on a run-rate basis and, accordingly, ----- PricewaterhouseCoopers d.o.o. Zagreb does not provide any form of assurance with respect thereto for the purpose of this offering memorandum.

Certain financial measures of United Group and ratios related thereto in this offering memorandum, including: - UG EBITDA, - UG Adjusted EBITDA, - UG Adjusted EBITDA Margin, - UG Adjusted EBITDA minus UG Adjusted Capital Expenditure, - UG Adjusted Capital Expenditure, and - UG Last Two Quarter Adjusted EBITDA on a pre-IFRS 16 basis; certain financial measures of Vivacom and ratios related thereto in this offering memorandum, including: - Vivacom EBITDA, - Vivacom Adjusted EBITDA, - Vivacom Adjusted EBITDA Margin, and - Vivacom Operating Free Cash Flow; certain pro forma financial measures of the Group and ratios related thereto in this offering memorandum, including: - Pro Forma Revenue, - Pro Forma Adjusted Capital Expenditure, - Pro Forma EBITDA, - Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA, and - Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA Margin; and certain run-rate financial measures of the Group and ratios related thereto in this offering memorandum, including: - Run-Rate Revenue, - Run-Rate Adjusted Capital Expenditure on a pre-IFRS 16 basis, - Run-Rate Annual Adjusted Debt Cash Interest Expense, - Run-Rate Last Two Quarter Adjusted EBITDA on a pre-IFRS 16 basis, - Run-rate Last Two Quarter Annualized Adjusted EBITDA on a pre-IFRS 16 basis, - Run-Rate Last Two Quarter Annualized Adjusted EBITDA on a pre-IFRS 16 basis Margin, - Run-Rate Last Two Quarter Annualized Adjusted EBITDA on a pre-IFRS 16 basis minus Run-Rate Adjusted Capital Expenditure on a pre-IFRS 16 basis, - Ratio of Adjusted Net Debt to Run-Rate Last Two Quarter Annualized Adjusted EBITDA on a pre-IFRS 16 basis, and - Ratio of Run-Rate Last Two Quarter Annualized Adjusted EBITDA on a pre-IFRS 16 basis to Run-Rate Annual Adjusted Debt Cash Interest Expense. together with compound annual growth rate (“CAGR”) are collectively referred to as the “Non-IFRS Measures.”The Non-IFRS Measures are not specifically defined under IFRS or any other generally accepted accounting principles. These measures are presented in this offering memorandum because we believe that they and similar measures are widely used in the telecommunications industry as a means of evaluating a company’s operating performance and financing structure. These measures may not be comparable to other similarly titled measures of other companies and are not measurements under IFRS or other generally accepted accounting principles, and you should not consider such items as alternatives to net income (loss), ----- operating income or any other performance measures derived in accordance with IFRS, and they may be different from similarly titled measures used by other companies. Our management believe the data for each respective company or group, along with comparable IFRS measures, is useful to investors because it provides a basis for measuring the operating performance in the periods presented. These measures are used in the internal management of our business, along with the most directly comparable IFRS financial measures, in evaluating operating performance. The Non-IFRS Measures have limitations as analytical tools, and you should not consider them in isolation or as a substitute for our or a relevant group’s results or any performance measures under IFRS as set forth in our consolidated financial statements or the Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Statements. Some of these limitations are: - they do not reflect our cash expenditures or future requirements for capital commitments; - they do not reflect changes in, or cash requirements for, our working capital needs; - they do not reflect the interest expense or cash requirements necessary to service interest or principal payments on our debt; - they do not reflect any cash income taxes that we may be required to pay; - they are not adjusted for all non-cash income or expense items that are reflected in our consolidated profit and loss statement; - they do not reflect the impact of earnings or charges resulting from certain matters we consider not to be indicative of our ongoing operations; - assets are depreciated or amortized over differing estimated useful lives and often have to be replaced in the future, and these measures do not reflect any cash requirements for such replacements; and - other companies in our industry may calculate these measures differently than we do, limiting their usefulness as comparative measures. Because of these limitations the Non-IFRS Measures should not be considered as measures of discretionary cash available to us to invest in the growth of our business or as measures of cash that will be available to us to meet our obligations. You should compensate for these limitations by relying primarily on our IFRS results and using these Non-IFRS Measures only supplementally to evaluate our performance. Please see “Summary _of Company and Group Run-Rate, Vivacom, Unaudited Pro Forma and Certain Other Financial Data,”_ “Selected Company Historical Financial Data,” “The Company’s Management’s Discussion and Analysis of _Financial Condition and Results of Operations”, “Vivacom’s Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations”, and the Company Audited Financial Statements (including the related_ notes), the Company Unaudited Interim Financial Statements (including the related notes), the Vivacom Audited Financial Statements (including the related notes) and the Vivacom Unaudited Interim Financial Statements (including the related notes) included elsewhere in this offering memorandum. For a description of how our Non-IFRS Measures are calculated from our consolidated results from operations and a reconciliation of our Non-IFRS Measures to our results for the periods presented in this offering memorandum, please see “Summary of Company and Group Run-Rate, Vivacom, Unaudited Pro _Forma and Certain Other Financial Data.”_ -----

This offering memorandum includes market share and industry information, which was obtained by us from industry publications and surveys. These include information published by Fitch Solutions, Oxford Economics, the International Monetary Fund (“IMF”), the Agency for Communication Networks and Services of the Republic of Slovenia (“AKOS”), the Serbian Regulatory Agency for Electronic Communications and Postal Services (“RATEL”), the Bulgarian Communications Regulation Commission (“CRC”), the Bosnian and Montenegrin Communications Regulatory Agencies, the Bulgarian National Statistical Institute (“BNSI”), the International Telecommunications Union (“ITU”), Eurostat, Ookla and other third-party sources. We have also obtained information or other statements presented in this offering memorandum relating to market share and industry data relating to our business from providers of industry data, including Ampere and IHS. As we do not have access to the facts and assumptions underlying such market data, statistical information and economic indicators contained in these third-party sources, we are unable to verify such information and cannot guarantee its accuracy or completeness. In addition, various economic and other factors may cause actual results to differ from these estimations. Any forward-looking statements contained in such industry and market data were made prior to the outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic and have not been updated to account for the impact of such outbreak. There can be no assurance that such forward-looking statements would not have been materially different if the COVID-19 pandemic had been taken into account. See “Forward-looking Statements.” Information that has been obtained from AKOS, RATEL and the Bosnian and Montenegrin Communications Regulatory Agencies has been obtained for the periods indicated. Some of the information below has been obtained from communications with the regulatory agencies in our core jurisdictions in addition to other third-party sources. Accordingly, this information has been presented as of different dates for different jurisdictions for the most recent period for which such information has been made available. Certain information in this offering memorandum represents our best estimate based upon information obtained from trade and business organizations and associations, consultants and other contacts within the industries in which we compete, information published by our competitors as well as our senior management’s business experience and experience in the industry and the local markets in which we operate. In particular, we prepared data (i) in respect of our market position based on information obtained from regulatory agencies and other contacts within the industry in which we compete and (ii) in respect of industry trends based on information obtained from regulatory agencies and other contacts within the industry in which we compete as well as our senior management’s business experience and experience in the industry and the local markets in which we operate. Our estimates derived from this information may be incorrect and actual facts may differ from our estimates. The information that we have included regarding our market share is calculated as a percentage of subscribers. None of the third-party sources described in this “Industry and Market Data” section, or any entity that directly or indirectly controls, is controlled by or is under common control with any such third-party source and any employee, director, partner or member of any such third-party source and/or of any such entity as aforesaid, accepts any responsibility in relation to or arising out of or in connection with this offering memorandum. Each trademark, trade name or service mark of any other company appearing in this offering memorandum belongs to its holder. Solely for convenience, the trademarks, trade names and copyrights referred to in this offering memorandum are listed without the TM, ® and © symbols. -----

Unless otherwise specified or the context requires otherwise in this offering memorandum references to: “2017 Indenture” refers to the indenture governing, inter alia, the Existing 2024 SSNs dated July 27, 2017, among, inter alios, United Group B.V., U.S. Bank Trustees Limited, as trustee, UniCredit Bank AG, London Branch, as security agent, and UniCredit Bank Serbia JSC Belgrade, as Serbian security agent, as amended, modified or supplemented from time to time; “2019 Indenture”refers to the indenture governing the Existing 2025 FRNs dated May 27, 2019, among, inter alios, United Group B.V., U.S. Bank Trustees Limited, as trustee, UniCredit Bank AG, London Branch, as security agent, UniCredit Bank Serbia JSC Belgrade, as Serbian security agent, as amended, modified or supplemented from time to time; “2019 Refinancing” refers to the issuance of the Existing 2025 FRNs, the redemption in full on May 17, 2019, of the €450 million in aggregate principal amount of the Issuer’s Floating Rate Senior Secured Notes due 2023 issued on July 27, 2017, the repayment of a portion of the borrowings under the Existing Revolving Credit Facility with the proceeds of the Existing 2025 FRNs, the Existing Revolving Credit Facility 2019 Increase and/or the related transactions in connection therewith; “2020 Financing” refers to (i) the issuance of the Existing 2026 SSNs, the Existing 2026 FRNs, the Existing 2028 SSNs by the Issuer, (ii) the issuance of €170 million of additional Existing PIK Notes by Summer BidCo, and (iii) the Existing Revolving Credit Facility Extension and 2020 Increase; “2020 Notes Issue Date” refers to the issue date of the Existing 2026 SSNs, Existing 2026 FRNs and Existing 2028 SSNs by the Issuer; “5G”refers to the fifth generation of broadband cellular network technology for mobile phones with increased speed and bandwidth as compared to 4G networks; “Adria Midco” refers to Adria Midco B.V., a private limited liability company (besloten vennootschap met _beperkte aansprakelijkheid) incorporated under the laws of the Netherlands with its corporate seat in_ Amsterdam, the Netherlands and address at Spicalaan 41, 2132 JG Hoofddorp, the Netherlands and trade register number 58913661; “Adria Topco” refers to Adria Topco B.V., a private limited liability company (besloten vennootschap met _beperkte aansprakelijkheid) incorporated under the laws of the Netherlands with its corporate seat in_ Amsterdam, the Netherlands and address at Spicalaan 41, 2132 JG Hoofddorp, the Netherlands and trade register number 58908773; “Agreed Security Principles” has the meaning ascribed to it under “Description of the New Notes”; “Authority” refers to The International Stock Exchange Authority Limited; “BAM” refers to the Bosnian Mark, the lawful currency of Bosnia and Herzegovina; “BGN” refers to the Bulgarian lev, the lawful currency of Bulgaria; “Bosnian Acquisitions” refers to the acquisition by the Group of (i) 100% of the issued and outstanding share capital of M&H Company d.o.o. Sarajevo, (ii) 64% of the issued and outstanding share capital of HKB net d.o.o. Sarajevo, (iii) 57% of the issued and outstanding share capital of KATV HS d.o.o. Sarajevo, (iv) 100% of the issued and outstanding share capital of Velnet d.o.o. Mostar, (v) 100% of the issued and outstanding share capital of VKT net d.o.o. Bugojno and (vi) 100% of the issued and outstanding share capital of BHB Cable TV d.o.o. Lukavac, collectively, in July 2015, for an aggregate purchase price of €30.2 million; “BTC” refers to Bulgarian Telecommunications Company EAD (trading as “Vivacom”); “BTC Indebtedness Refinancing” refers to the amount of the proceeds of the 2020 Financing equal to the amount used to repay fully and irrevocably all obligations of BTC under a €365 million senior facilities agreement dated December 22, 2017, as amended, and the €35 million revolving credit facility dated November 22, 2013 as amended; “Clearstream” refers to Clearstream Banking, S.A.; “CME” refers to Central European Media Enterprises Ltd.; ----- “CME B.V.”refers to CME Media Enterprises B.V., a media and entertainment company operating businesses in Central and Eastern European markets and a wholly-owned indirect subsidiary of CME, which sold certain assets to us in the Nova TV Croatia Acquisition; “Collateral” has the meaning ascribed to it under “Summary—Summary Offering Terms—Security for the _New Notes”;_ “Combined Group” refers to the Group, including the contribution of Forthnet, Nova BG and Optima Telekom; “Company refers to Adria Midco or, in the case of historical financial information in respect of the Company, Adria Midco and its consolidated subsidiaries; “D Express” means D Express d.o.o. Beograd; “Dan Graf” means Dan Graf d.o.o. Beograd; “Direct Media” refers to Direct Media preduzeće za marketinške i promotivne aktivnosti d.o.o. Beograd; “Direct Media/Pink Acquisition” refers to the acquisition of Direct Media by United Media S.à r.l. from Ascanius Netherlands B.V. pursuant to a share purchase agreement dated as of September 4, 2018; “DSL” refers to digital subscriber line technology, which is a data communications technology, which can come in the form of DSL, asymmetric digital subscriber line and very high bit rate digital subscriber line (“VDSL”); “DTH” refers to direct to home satellite services; “DTT” refers to digital terrestrial television; “EU” refers to the European Union; “euro” or “€” refers to the lawful currency of the European Monetary Union; “Euroclear” refers to Euroclear Bank SA/NV; “EuroDOCSIS” refers to the European implementation of an international telecommunications standard that permits the addition of high-speed data transfer to an existing cable television system; “Exchange” means The International Stock Exchange; “Exchange Act”refers to the U.S. Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, and the rules and regulations promulgated thereunder; “Existing 2024 SSNs”refers to the €325 million in aggregate principal amount of 4.875% senior secured notes due 2024 issued by the Issuer under the 2017 Indenture and the €200 million in aggregate principal amount of additional 4.875% senior secured notes due 2024 issued by the Issuer under the 2017 Indenture; “Existing 2025 FRNs” refers to the €550 million in aggregate principal amount of floating rate senior secured notes due 2025 issued by the Issuer under the 2019 Indenture; “Existing 2026 SSNs”refers to the €600 million in aggregate principal amount of 3.125% senior secured notes due 2026 issued by the Issuer under the Indenture; “Existing 2026 FRNs”refers to the €450 million in aggregate principal amount of floating rate notes due 2026 issued by the Issuer under the Indenture; “Existing 2027 SSNs”refers to the €550 million in aggregate principal amount of 4% senior secured notes due 2027 issued by the Issuer under the Indenture;
