We are the leading cable and media player in Southeastern Europe, providing services to approximately 3.7 million homes as of March 31, 2021. We are the leading distributor of Pay-TV in our core markets of Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina and the number two distributor in Montenegro. As of March 31, 2021, we provided services to approximately 10.9 million RGUs and analog and digital cable Pay-TV services to approximately 1.9 million unique subscribers. United Group’s revenue for the three months ended March 31, 2021 was €439.4 million and UG Adjusted EBITDA was €179.2 million. The Group had Run-Rate Revenue for the annualized last two quarters ended March 31, 2021 of €1,976.4 million and Run-Rate Last Two Quarter Annualized Adjusted EBITDA on a pre-IFRS 16 basis for March 31, 2021 was €706.3 million. The Combined Group is the clear multi-play leader in its footprint, with market leading positions in Pay-TV, broadband internet and fixed-line and mobile-telephony in Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Bulgaria, Croatia and, following the Forthnet Acquisition, Greece. The Combined Group’s addressable market comprised 13.4 million households as of December 31, 2020. We have grown rapidly through both acquisitions and organic growth. In July 2020, we acquired Vivacom, the market leading integrated telecommunications operator in Bulgaria, based on total revenue for the year ended December 31, 2020, which is the leading operator in fixed-line telephony services and broadband services, the number three provider of mobile-telephony services and the number three provider of Pay-TV, in each case, by number of subscribers as of March 31, 2021. The Vivacom Acquisition increased our addressable market by approximately 35% in terms of population, and the addition of Vivacom’s subscriber base more than doubled our existing subscriber base. In March 2020, we also acquired Tele2 Croatia, the third largest telecommunications operator in Croatia, based on mobile revenues as of March 31, 2021, through which we offer mobile services in Croatia. In November 2020, we completed the acquisition of a controlling interest (the “Forthnet Acquisition”) in Forthnet S.A. (“Forthnet”), a prominent telecom operator and Pay-TV provider in Greece, which marked our entry into the Greek market and will strengthen our position as an industry leader in Southeastern Europe. In January 2021, we acquired Bulgaria’s largest multi-platform media company, Nova Broadcasting Group EOOD, from Advance Media Group EAD (the “Nova Broadcasting Group Acquisition”), providing a strong base for our content offering in Bulgaria. In July 2021, we signed an agreement to acquire a majority interest (the “Optima Telekom Acquisition”) in OT-Optima Telekom d.d. (“Optima Telekom”), a Croatian telecom operator offering a broad range of fixed internet and pay-TV services. Subject to its completion, the Optima Telekom Acquisition will allow us to further expand our presence in the Croatian market and offer a full range of telecommunication services, including pay-TV, through our existing infrastructure in the country. We offer a diverse and differentiated line of products and services. We are the leading distributor of satellite (“DTH”) Pay-TV across Southeastern Europe, with Pay-TV product and service offerings in each of Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, North Macedonia and Montenegro, where we use our Total TV platform to serve subscribers both inside and outside of our cable footprint to deliver content across the entire region, including rural areas. Following the Vivacom Acquisition, we also provide Pay-TV services in Bulgaria and are the leading IPTV provider in Bulgaria, while the Nova Broadcasting Group Acquisition strengthened our content offering in Bulgaria. Following the Forthnet Acquisition, we also provide cable and DTH services in Greece. In addition to our cable-based and satellite-based services, we offer mobile-telephony services in Slovenia, Bulgaria and Croatia. We provide 4G LTE coverage to almost the entire population in each of these countries, and we are rolling out 5G networks across our mobile-telephony footprint. On September 21, 2020, we announced the commercial launch of our 5G network in Bulgaria, and to that end in May 2021, we secured a 20-year license for 100 MHz spectrum frequencies in the 3.6 GHz band. We also in April 2021 secured 15-year spectrum licenses in Slovenia for 5G frequencies, and commenced deployment and commercial launch of 5G 3600 MHz in Slovenia in June 2021. We are participating in a 5G spectrum auction in Croatia this year. ----- Our core telecommunications business is also complemented by our two over-the-top (“OTT”) distribution platforms that customers can access through internet based streaming: EON, our regional OTT platform, which enables customers connected to our competitors’ broadband internet connections outside of our cable footprint to access our attractive portfolio of Pay-TV channels, and NetTV Plus, our international OTT platform, which delivers ethnic and local language content to the ex-Yugoslav diaspora around the world. In July 2020, we launched Shoppster, our regional e-commerce online-shopping platform, which offers more than 20 popular product categories, including electronics, home and gardening, tools, fashion, items for children and kitchen appliances. Shoppster is available as an integrated online and TV shopping platform in Serbia and Slovenia. Through our in-house content business, we produce distinctive and attractive in-house media content for our Pay-TV channels across multiple key genres that have historically driven Pay-TV subscriptions. These channels include Southeastern Europe’s most popular family of branded Pay-TV sports channels, as well as popular movie channels, children’s channels, a 24/7 news channel, music channels and other specialized channels, which we continue to expand both organically and through acquisitions. We currently produce over 40% of the total content in our national (terrestrial) and cable operations, and our programs typically receive ratings of between 30% to 60% in the markets in which they are available. The Group also has in-house media and content production in Greece. We believe that our market leading content portfolio differentiates us from our competitors, has enabled strong growth in our business and provides us with predictable third-party carriage fees. As part of our media business, we also provide advertising services and digital production and distribution. Our Nova TV Croatia channel has strong local content production and profitability, with an audience share of 40% and market share by advertising revenue of 50%. Nova BH and Nova M have appealing content, such as popular national team football events until 2022, such as the Euro Cup qualifiers, Euro Cup, World Cup qualifiers and League of Nations. In March 2019, we launched Nova S in Serbia. Nova S is a channel offering high-quality local production series, sports, talk shows with well-known national presenters and high-quality international productions, fully exclusive to SBB, Total TV and EON. The Nova Broadcasting Group Acquisition makes us a major content player in Bulgaria by adding Nova BG’s media platform comprising ten television channels, including NOVA TV, which broadcasts throughout Bulgaria, Bulgaria’s largest online platform, Net Info, which reaches on average 80% of the Bulgarian population each month, and four radio stations. In addition to our own content, as a result of our pan regional presence and well established distribution network, we are a distribution partner of choice for premium regional and international content owners, such as Discovery/Eurosport, Viacom, AXN, CNN, HBO, Fox and Universal, and sports rights owners, such as the English Premier League, Spanish Football League LaLiga, 2020 UEFA European Championship qualifiers, 2020 UEFA European Championship, 2022 FIFA World Cup qualifiers, UEFA League of Nations, ATP, Formula 1, Euroleague, and Moto GP, which we believe allows us to consistently obtain high-quality content and attractive payment terms. Nova BG holds licenses to offer compelling content in Bulgaria through distributors such as CBS Intenrational, the Walt Disney Company, Columbia Pictures and Paramount Pictures, as well as popular sports content such as the English Premier League football, Euro Cup qualifiers and the Euro Cup and Formula One racing. We believe these providers partner with us because of our well-known brands, large network and our focus on Southeastern Europe. We operate most of our business across eight countries in Southeastern Europe: Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, North Macedonia, Montenegro and Greece. These countries have a combined population of approximately 40 million, distributed across approximately 13.4 million households as of December 31, 2020, and represent the second-largest Central and Eastern European (“CEE”) market after Poland. Despite economic differences, many of these countries share a joint history and form a single market in which small local differences are overshadowed by the influence of similarities in cultural preferences and language across the region and are characterized by growing Pay-TV and broadband markets that are currently underpenetrated relative to some other CEE and Western European markets. We are the leading multi-play provider in Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina and Bulgaria, where we combine our services into packages, or bundles, which offer subscribers the convenience of being able to purchase television, broadband internet and telephony services from a single provider, and provides us with significant opportunities to cross-sell our products. We believe that we are well-positioned to maintain our market leading positions in the Pay-TV and cable broadband internet markets in Slovenia, Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina, and to further increase our market shares, as we differentiate our product offerings through one of the highest download speeds in our ----- broadband markets, access to desirable media content, a well invested network and high-quality customer service, which has led to relatively low churn rates which we believe demonstrate customer loyalty. We also believe that we are well-positioned to continue to grow in our region, and build on our expansion into Bulgaria and Greece. Our customers view the telecommunications products and services that we offer as part of their everyday lives, which results in recurring, high demand for our products and makes our business more resilient to macro-economic disruptions when compared to other discretionary products and services. For example, during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic our products and services have been instrumental in providing connectivity and entertainment, as an increasing number of people began to work or study remotely and spent significant amounts of time at home, which resulted in a significant increase in our voice and data traffic between March and May 2020. In particular, over this period, our fixed data traffic increased at rates between 50% and 70%, while fixed voice traffic increased at rates between 50% and 85%, depending on the country. In addition, our mobile data and voice traffic increased at rates between 30% and 40%, depending on the country. Traffic levels decreased during the summer months and started increasing again as new lockdowns were implemented in various countries. To accommodate such higher customer demand, we increased capacity on network elements and interconnections. In this recurring, high demand environment, we believe we offer superior products, faster broadband speeds and higher quality content than many of our competitors.

Subsubsection Title: We are the leading multi-play service provider with a pan regional platform across Southeastern Europe.
Subsubsection Text: We are the leading multi-play telecommunications and media provider in Southeastern Europe, a position which we have strengthened significantly through the Vivacom Acquisition. Specifically, we are the leading provider of Pay-TV in our three core markets of Slovenia, Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina, and the leading provider of broadband in Slovenia and Bosnia and Herzegovina, in each case, based on market share by number of subscribers. We are also the leading provider of broadband and the number three provider of Pay-TV in Bulgaria based on market share by number of subscribers for the year ended December 31, 2020, and the second-largest Pay-TV operator in Greece. In addition to our cable-based and satellite-based services, we offer mobile-telephony services in Slovenia, in Bulgaria and in Croatia. The acquisitions we have made have delivered significant geographic expansion and diversification of our business into Bulgaria and Greece. The Vivacom Acquisition, for example, increased our addressable market by 35% in terms of population, and doubled our existing customer base. Furthermore, our scale and presence across Southeastern Europe and across our product portfolios allows us to cross-sell our services and expand the number of multi-play packages we provide, creating opportunities to expand our customer base. The table below shows key operating and financial data of the Group as of and for the three months ended March 31, 2021, except where otherwise noted. -----

Customers of Forthnet are serviced through a local loop unbundling arrangement with the incumbent OTE. We are the pan regional leader for Pay-TV services with 2.6 million unique Pay-TV subscribers as of March 31, 2021, and we have leveraged our complementary cable and DTH platforms to gain a leading Pay-TV market share of 46% in Serbia, as of March 31, 2021, 39% in Slovenia as of December 31, 2020, and 41% in Bosnia and Herzegovina, as of December 31, 2020, 26% in Bulgaria, as of December 31, 2020, and 28% in Greece, as of December 31, 2020, each based on number of subscribers. In addition, we are the largest DTH Pay-TV provider in Montenegro and are among the main providers of DTH Pay-TV in North Macedonia and Croatia. We are the leading high-speed cable broadband internet provider in each of Slovenia, Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina within our footprint in each country and have a large broadband market share overall, behind only the respective incumbents with national footprints. In Bulgaria, we are the market leader in broadband by number of subscribers, with a market share of 33% as of December 31, 2020. We leveraged our Pay-TV and cable broadband internet capabilities to become the second-largest fixed-line telephony provider in Slovenia, Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina. Following the liberalization of the telephony markets in Bosnia and Herzegovina and Serbia, which allowed customers to retain their existing telephone number when switching to our network in 2014, we have substantially grown our fixed-line telephony subscriber numbers. In addition, in Bulgaria, we are the market leader in fixed-line telephony, with a 66% market share by number of subscribers as of September 30, 2020. In mobile-telephony, we are the third largest mobile network operator (“MNO”) in Slovenia, with a market share of 24% as of March 31, 2021. We are also the third largest MNO in both Bulgaria, with a market share

Subsubsection Title: We benefit from diversified revenue streams within our markets and an improved currency mix.
Subsubsection Text: Due to our leading market positions in Slovenia, Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina, and our position as a pan regional services provider, our business benefits from geographically diversified and product portfolio diversified revenue streams, which we have further diversified following the Vivacom Acquisition and Forthnet Acquisition. In terms of geographic diversity, the table below presents the percentage of revenue derived by jurisdiction (as a percentage of gross revenue, excluding intercompany revenue) for the three months ended March 31, 2021, after giving effect to the Vivacom Acquisition, the Tele2 Croatia Acquisition, the Forthnet Acquisition, the Nova Broadcasting Group Acquisition and other acquisitions: ++ ++ ++ ++ + [New M&A] (1) CroatiaCroatia companies

Subsubsection Text: ----- by number of subscribers of 30%, and Croatia, with a market share of 19%, in each case, as of March 31, 2021. Between 2017 and 2019, Vivacom’s mobile revenue grew at a CAGR of 4%, demonstrating Vivacom’s strong momentum in the mobile market. In July 2020, we leveraged our position in both the broadband and Pay-TV markets to launch Shoppster, our regional e-commerce online-shopping platform, which offers more than 20 popular product categories, including electronics, home and gardening, tools, fashion, items for children and kitchen appliances. Shoppster is available as an integrated online and TV shopping platform in Serbia and Slovenia. In Serbia, Shoppster operates as a marketplace using the dropshipping operating model, whereby it does not stock the products it sells. In Slovenia, Shoppster operates as a retailer as a result of an acquisition that we have completed and stores the products it sells in a leased warehouse. Products sold though Shoppster are distributed by third-party delivery couriers in both Serbia and Slovenia. Shoppster is a unique offering which combines the convenience of online-shopping with the audience engagement of television. Products are presented and available for sale on the Shoppster TV channel, which is devoted to homeshopping. Popular TV personalities from Southeastern Europe present offers and products from the many companies that have joined Shoppster. We intend for Shoppster to deliver the simple, reliable and secure e-shopping experience that modern consumers expect.

Subsubsection Title: Our business and market positioning benefit from a well invested, advanced cable network infrastructure with a broad reach across the region and from national mobile networks in Slovenia, Bulgaria and Croatia.
Subsubsection Text: We strive to be the most advanced media and telecommunications company in Southeastern Europe. We operate an advanced proprietary hybrid fiber coaxial (“HFC”) network which is fully bi-directional and EuroDOCSIS 3.0 enabled, covering all of our homes passed in Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina and Montenegro, and approximately 98% of homes passed in our HFC network in Slovenia as of November 1, 2020 are fully bi-directional. We operate the largest fiber network in the region, comprised of 8,966 kilometers of backbone and extending 10,119 kilometers across metropolitan regions in Slovenia (approximately 3,506 kilometers), Serbia (approximately 4,907 kilometers), Bosnia and Herzegovina (approximately 1,080 kilometers) and Montenegro (approximately 626 kilometers). We also operate one of the largest fiber networks in Bulgaria, with 1.7 million (or 58%) of households in the country covered and a fully owned fiber connecting to major points of presence across Europe. As of March 31, 2021, 91% of our core network was DOCSIS 3.1 ready. With the addition of Vivacom’s cable network, our cable network covers approximately 3.7 million homes passed, as of March 31, 2021. Our network has an average homes passed per fiber optics node ratio in the range of approximately 274, 213 and 234 across Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, respectively, which we believe is unrivalled in Southeastern Europe and compares favorably to other European cable operators, which average 562 homes passed per node on the basis of comparable peers operating in UK, Sweden, Spain, Germany and Belgium. We believe that our cable TV infrastructure allows us to provide higher quality digital TV, high-speed broadband and fixed-line telephony than other cable operators in our markets. Our EuroDOCSIS 3.0 network allows us to compete effectively in Slovenia, where fiber to the home (“FttH”) constituted approximately 44% of the broadband market share as of December 31, 2020. We can match FttH speeds in overlapping markets and have a service speed advantage in non-FttH areas. In Serbia, our broadband internet speed gives us an advantage over most of our broadband internet competitors, and we provide broadband speeds of 75-1000 Mbps for the majority of our subscribers in Serbia. We also provide internet download speeds which we believe compare favorably to the national average in Serbia with our average recorded download speed being 1.8x faster than that of one of our main competitors. Additionally, we also believe that we provide superior internet download speeds in Slovenia with our average recorded download speed being 2.9x faster than that ----- of one of our main competitors (which the competitor is only able to offer in certain geographic areas). In Bosnia and Herzegovina, we are well-positioned to compete with incumbents that primarily use DSL, as well as with smaller regional cable operators. In Bosnia and Herzegovina, we believe that our average recorded download speed is 4.5x faster than that of one our main competitors. In Montenegro, we have developed FttH Gigabit capable Passive Optical Networks (“GPON”) with over 25,438 homes passed and over 5,742 homes connected to this network. Following the Vivacom Acquisition, we operate the largest fiber network in Bulgaria, providing VDSL with speeds of more than 70 Mbps for more than 50% of our network and more than 50 Mbps for 74% of our network, with full redundancy capability and high service reliability. Our mobile network covers the majority of Slovenia’s population through our extensive 2G/3G/4G networks, and at present we have the capability to provide 4G (LTE) and 4G+ (LTE-A) coverage to approximately 99% and 98%, respectively, of the Slovenian population. We are also the third largest mobile operator in Bulgaria by market share, with approximately three million subscribers as of March 31, 2021, and provide LTE mobile network coverage to 99.94% of the Bulgarian population. We believe Vivacom’s mobile strategy, which includes attractive tariff plans, flexible service bundles, integrated IT systems and the fastest 4G/LTE mobile network in Europe, has allowed it to differentiate itself from competitors and consistently gain market share in recent years. In addition, we are the third largest telecommunications operator in Croatia based on mobile revenues as of March 31, 2021, with a highly competitive 4G service, a signal covering all major cities and important roads in Croatia and a growing customer base of nearly one million as of March 31, 2021. To further develop our networks, we have successfully tested and are rolling out next generation 5G networks across our mobile-telephony footprint. On September 21, 2020, we announced the commercial launch of our 5G network in Bulgaria, and to that end in May 2021, we secured a 20-year license for 100 MHz spectrum frequencies in the 3.6 GHz band. We also in April 2021 secured 15-year spectrum licenses in Slovenia for 5G frequencies, and commenced deployment and commercial launch of 5G 3600 MHz in Slovenia in June 2021. We are participating in a 5G spectrum auction in Croatia this year. We believe that our cable network is well invested and benefits from low maintenance UG Adjusted Capital Expenditure requirements. We believe that this will allow us to manage our UG Adjusted Capital Expenditure in the near to medium term, with expenditures largely being success and capacity based as our business expands, while making targeted improvements to our network. We believe that Vivacom has a similarly well invested network and profile. UG Adjusted Capital Expenditure was €91.3 million for the three months ended March 31, 2021, and we estimate that UG Adjusted Capital Expenditure for the year ended December 31, 2021 will be between €371 million and €373 million (excluding mobile frequencies and any amounts for Forthnet, Nova BG or Optima Telekom ). Subsubsection Title: Strong track record of profitable growth driven by low penetration rates and cross-selling opportunities, as well as successful integration of acquisitions.
Subsubsection Text: We have a strong track record of profitable growth, underpinned by low penetration rates in the markets in which we operate and cross-selling opportunities due to our scale, as well as a record of successfully integrating acquisitions. We operate most of our business across the following eight countries in Southeastern Europe: Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, Greece, North Macedonia and Montenegro. These countries are characterized by growing Pay-TV and broadband markets that are currently underpenetrated relative to some other CEE and Western European markets. Following the Forthnet Acquisition we also operate in Greece. As of March 31, 2021, in Slovenia, our Pay-TV penetration of homes passed and broadband internet penetration were 61% and 89%, respectively; in Serbia, Pay-TV penetration and broadband internet penetration were 65% and 73%, respectively; and in Bosnia and Herzegovina, Pay-TV penetration and broadband internet penetration were 61% and 81%, respectively. Additionally, due to historically strong regulatory constraints on bundling Pay-TV, broadband internet and telephony services, RGUs per cable subscriber in our key markets in Serbia, Slovenia and Bosnia and Herzegovina have lagged behind CEE and Western European cable markets. Markets in Bulgaria have similar characteristics. Our cable RGUs per subscriber ratios of 2.3x for Serbia, 2.7x for Slovenia and 2.3x for Bosnia and Herzegovina, in each case as of March 31, 2021, demonstrate that there are strong opportunities to continue to utilize up selling and cross-selling opportunities to grow our cable RGUs per subscriber ratio in Slovenia. ----- The following table shows comparisons of RGUs per cable subscriber in certain key CEE and Western European markets with those of certain other industry members: Source: Public company filings. As of March 31, 2021, for United Group, Telenet and Euskaltel and as of June 30, 2018 for the other industry peers. The methodologies used to calculate and report RGUs and RGUs per cable subscriber by certain other industry members may vary. At the same time, Pay-TV penetration in all of our markets has been growing, driven by increasingly attractive content and bundled offers. Service penetration in our markets has increased as multi-play packages have expanded but is still below the levels of some Western European cable markets (except in Slovenia). Leveraging our extensive cable infrastructure, we use our high-quality Pay-TV content as a basis to cross and up sell our broadband internet and telephony products to existing cable Pay-TV customers and offer multi-play packages to new customers, which we expect will allow us to continue to improve penetration rates as customers increasingly focus on the convenience of receiving their multimedia and communications services in a bundled offer from one provider. For example, while penetration rates in Slovenia are more comparable to those of Western European operators, a substantial number of our subscribers in Slovenia are subscribed to a single service, which we believe offers significant cross-selling opportunities. Our number of quad-play subscribers in Slovenia has grown since we began offering mobile services in late 2012 as an MVNO, and, since the acquisition of Tušmobil in April 2015, we have increased the number of quad-play subscribers in Slovenia, from 1% in April 2015 to 38% as of March 31, 2021. In addition to organic growth, we have made targeted and value accretive investments and acquisitions of attractive cable and mobile assets, and we have been successful at integrating these acquisitions and realizing synergies related to a number of these acquisitions, providing lessons learned and significant know-how for integrating Vivacom, Forthnet, Nova BG and Tele2 Croatia. For example, our acquisition of Telemach Slovenia from Liberty Global in 2009, a foray into a new market with a different language and culture, proved to be a successful cross border acquisition story. Within a decade, we tripled blended cable ARPU of Telemach Slovenia (from €13 in 2008, to €35 in 2018) and adjusted EBITDA (from €24 million in 2008, to €71 million in 2018), while revenue grew from €46 million in 2008 to €1.2 billion in the year ended December 31, 2020. This was achieved through both organic growth and the acquisition of Tušmobil in April 2015 which provided us with an opportunity to create a fully convergent cable, internet, fixed-line and mobile-telephony operator in Slovenia, and allowed Slovenian customers to benefit from a convenient bundled product offering consisting of cable Pay-TV, internet, fixed-line and mobile-telephony services from a single provider. We have a strong track record of profitable growth, underpinned by low penetration rates in the markets in which we operate and cross-selling opportunities due to our scale, as well as a record of successfully integrating acquisitions. Subsubsection Title: We have a track record of delivering revenue and UG Adjusted EBITDA growth and realizing cost synergies related to our acquisitions while generating strong UG Adjusted EBITDA margins.
Subsubsection Text: Our revenues have historically proven to be resilient, even during periods of challenging economic conditions. During the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, almost all of our revenue streams have proven resilient and stable, particularly those generated by our telecommunication business segments, such as broadband internet and mobile-telephony. Since 2018, we have increased RGUs from 3.8 million as of December 31, 2018, to 10.9 million as of March 31, 2021, and we have delivered strong organic growth in both revenue and UG Adjusted EBITDA during such period, significantly outperforming GDP growth in the countries in which we operate. In addition to organic growth, we have benefitted from targeted and value accretive investments and acquisitions of attractive cable and mobile assets, and have been successful in integrating these acquisitions ----- and realizing synergies related to them. Our revenue increased to €439 million for the three months ended March 31, 2021, compared to €194 million for the three months ended March 31, 2020, and UG Adjusted EBITDA increased to €179 million for the three months ended March 31, 2021, compared to €85 million for the three months ended March 31, 2020. We have also proven our ability to generate strong adjusted EBITDA margins. Despite investments in new ventures, we had operating profit margin of 11% and 7% for the three months ended March 31, 2020 and 2021, respectively, and maintained UG Adjusted EBITDA margins of 44% and 41% for the three months ended March 31, 2020 and 2021, respectively, highlighting our successful approach to integrating new businesses and driving profitability. We have also proven our ability to generate strong adjusted EBITDA margins. Despite investments in new ventures, we had operating profit margin of 11% and 7% for the three months ended March 31, 2020 and 2021, respectively, and maintained UG Adjusted EBITDA margins of 44% and 41% for the three months ended March 31, 2020 and 2021, respectively, highlighting our successful approach to integrating new businesses and driving profitability.

Subsubsection Title: A highly experienced management team with a proven track record of supporting and growing our business and successfully integrating accretive, cross border acquisitions, with a highly committed Sponsor.
Subsubsection Text: Many of our key management members have been with the business since its inception, including our founder and chairman of the advisory board, Dragan Šolak; chief executive officer and group vice president of marketing and media, Victoriya Boklag; and group vice president of operations, Violeta Vasilijević. Our senior management team also includes Janez Živko, group vice president of finance, who joined in March 2015 and had previously served as the chief financial officer of the Petrol Group, one of the largest companies in Slovenia; Vladislav Ratajac, group vice president of corporate development, joined management in 2011, having previously held positions at Mid Europa Partners and Deutsche Bank; Željko Batistić, group vice president of technology who joined the group in 2012 as CEO of Telemach Bosnia and prior to that held a number of technical and operational management positions in the industry; and Dragica Pilipović Chaffey, group vice president of corporate affairs, joined the management team in 2009 and had previously held a number of senior posts in the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development. Other members of our senior management team also have substantial experience in the telecommunications, media and technology industry, as well as in banking, private equity and corporate finance firms. Many members of our senior management team, including our founder, have each held different positions within our business and have shaped the direction of our development and growth within Southeastern Europe. As our operations have become more mature, the senior management team has been positioned to leverage its significant industry experience and corporate background and to successfully expand our business through bolt on acquisitions and integration of cable assets and content companies. Furthermore, certain members of management hold significant equity stakes in the business, which amount to approximately 42%. See “Principal Shareholders.” Due in part to the significant international experience of most members of the senior management team, who either attended university abroad or worked internationally for a prolonged period of time, we have successfully grown our business from being a single country Pay-TV operator to being the telecommunications and media services leader in Southeastern Europe. We also intend to draw from the market expertise, business relationships, knowledge and experience of our sponsor, BC Partners. BC Partners has strong telecommunications expertise and an extensive and successful track record of investing in companies in Europe and in the telecommunications and information sectors through portfolio companies that include: - Advanced Computer Software Group, which is a leading UK provider of critical software to mid-sized companies and public sector organizations; - NAVEX Global, which is the global leader in ethics and compliance software as a service provider; - Suddenlink Communications, which was the seventh largest cable operator by subscribers in the United States prior to its acquisition by Altice USA in 2015, and which BC Partners fully exited in 2020; - Com Hem, Sweden’s leading cable TV and broadband operator, which was successfully floated on the Nasdaq Stockholm exchange in 2014 and which BC Partners fully exited in 2017; and - Unitymedia, an integrated telecoms service provider and the second-largest cable company in Germany, which BC Partners sold to Liberty Global in 2009 after growing the business through acquisitions and operational improvements. BC Partners has a strong track record of driving cost savings and improvements in margin, while at the same time growing its portfolio companies both organically and through targeted acquisitions. BC Partners has a strong track record of driving cost savings and improvements in margin, while at the same time growing its portfolio companies both organically and through targeted acquisitions.

Subsubsection Title: Our business and market positioning benefit from a well invested, advanced cable network infrastructure with a broad reach across the region and from national mobile networks in Slovenia, Bulgaria and Croatia.
Strong track record of profitable growth driven by low penetration rates and cross-selling opportunities, as well as successful integration of acquisitions.
We have a track record of delivering revenue and UG Adjusted EBITDA growth and realizing cost synergies related to our acquisitions while generating strong UG Adjusted EBITDA margins.

A highly experienced management team with a proven track record of supporting and growing our business and successfully integrating accretive, cross border acquisitions, with a highly committed Sponsor.

Subsubsection Text: ----- ability to up sell and cross-sell products. Our customers view the telecommunications products and services that we offer as part of their everyday lives, which results in recurring, high demand for our products and makes our business more resilient to macro-economic disruptions when compared to other discretionary products and services. For example, during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic our products and services have been instrumental in providing connectivity and entertainment, as an increasing number of people began to work or study remotely and spend significant amounts of time at home, which resulted in a significant increase in our voice and data traffic between March and May 2020. In particular, over this period, our fixed data traffic increased at rates between 50% and 70%, while fixed voice traffic increased at rates between 50% and 85%, depending on the country. In addition, our mobile data and voice traffic increased at rates between 30% and 40%, depending on the country. To accommodate such higher customer demand, we increased capacity on network elements and interconnections. In this recurring, high demand environment, we believe we offer superior products, faster broadband speeds and higher quality content than our competitors. Customer loyalty is evidenced by our relatively low historical churn rates. Churn rate is defined as the percentage of customers that no longer subscribe for a certain service compared to the average number of customers in a particular month. Churn rates for a period of one year or longer are an average of the monthly average churn rate. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, our unique cable subscriber churn rate annualized was 10%, which is below recent reported cable subscriber churn rates of certain Western European peers. We believe our relatively low churn rates provide, among other benefits, recurring cash flows and visibility with respect to future revenue. Moreover, these churn rates have persisted notwithstanding regular price increases. From 2017, our Blended Cable ARPU excluding Vivacom has grown from €20.5 for the nine months ended September 30, 2017 to €23.2 for the three months ended March 31, 2021, representing a CAGR of 3.6%. Average triple play monthly fees have also increased across geographies, from €28 in 2013 to €33 for legacy packages (21% of triple play base) and €34 for current EON packages (78% of triple play base) in Serbia, from €41 in 2015 to €46 for legacy packages (28% of triple play base) and €48 for current EON packages (72% of triple play base) in Slovenia, and from €27 in 2013 to €31 for legacy packages (21% of triple play base) and €32 for current EON packages (78% of triple play base) in Bosnia and Herzegovina, each for the three months ended March 31, 2021. In addition, Vivacom’s declining churn rates, together with our experience in driving customer loyalty, present significant upside potential. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, Vivacom’s mobile subscriber churn rate was 18% annualized compared to 25% for the year ended December 31, 2017, and its IPTV subscriber churn rate was 11% annualized compared to 15% for the year ended December 31, 2017. ----- ability to up sell and cross-sell products. Subsubsection Title: Continued focus on our competitive market position by leveraging our advanced network, differentiated content offerings and loyal customer base.
Subsubsection Text: We have differentiated ourselves with our customers by having superior next generation infrastructure in our footprint. Where we believe the return on investment is appropriate, we will continue to expand the coverage and capacity of those networks, including 5G capability. Our strategy is to continue to offer the most attractive products in Southeastern Europe with better content choice, speed, functionality and service quality than those of our competitors, at prices that provide a compelling value. We will continue to deliver value to our customers based on a consistent and effective strategy that is underpinned by simplicity, value for money and innovation. We believe that our acquisitions of Vivacom, Tele2 Croatia, Forthnet, Nova BG and Optima Telekom are in line with a strategy of expanding coverage in Southeastern Europe and will enable the development of our business in attractive markets. We have differentiated ourselves with our customers by having superior next generation infrastructure in our footprint. Where we believe the return on investment is appropriate, we will continue to expand the coverage and capacity of those networks, including 5G capability. Our strategy is to continue to offer the most attractive products in Southeastern Europe with better content choice, speed, functionality and service quality than those of our competitors, at prices that provide a compelling value. We will continue to deliver value to our customers based on a consistent and effective strategy that is underpinned by simplicity, value for money and innovation. We believe that our acquisitions of Vivacom, Tele2 Croatia, Forthnet, Nova BG and Optima Telekom are in line with a strategy of expanding coverage in Southeastern Europe and will enable the development of our business in attractive markets.

Subsubsection Title: Increase service penetration across the region by cross-selling products and services and up selling value adding products to existing customers.
Subsubsection Text: We intend to continue to focus on subscriber growth opportunities in our relatively under penetrated markets. Over time, we expect our businesses in Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina to converge with Slovenia in terms of broadband and Pay-TV penetration as well as in service penetration (measured by RGU per subscriber). We aim to achieve an increase in triple play (and in the case of Slovenia and Bulgaria, quad-play) penetration by continuing to shift focus in marketing and subscriber interactions from single services to bundled services and utilizing next generation digital television services, attractive local content and high-speed broadband services to continue to promote bundled services. We have significantly grown our mobile business and developed our multi-play (including quad-play) offering in Slovenia, and we intend to continue to build on that success in Bulgaria, where the Vivacom Acquisition has significantly expanded our addressable market, and provide further opportunities for cross-selling and multi-play bundling. In particular, we intend to leverage Vivacom’s high-quality 4G/LTE network to expand its leadership in mobile data and build on its track record of subscriber growth. In addition, we aim to retain and grow Vivacom’s existing customer base by competing on value, for example, by offering more add on products, incentivizing longer term contracts by offering better pricing and subsidies for certain products, offering bundled services to decrease churn, including premium Pay-TV services and providing FTTx solutions in larger cities to satisfy customer demand for high broadband speeds. We also intend to capitalize on our superior high-speed broadband capabilities to increase revenue. Specifically, we intend to migrate our existing high-speed broadband subscribers to higher speeds, which we believe will continue to support broadband ARPU growth and further reduce residential subscriber churn rates. In addition, recent acquisitions have enhanced our ability to monetize premium content, cross promote and generate compelling cost synergies. We intend to continue to focus on subscriber growth opportunities in our relatively under penetrated markets. We also intend to capitalize on our superior high-speed broadband capabilities to increase revenue. Specifically, we intend to migrate our existing high-speed broadband subscribers to higher speeds, which we believe will continue to support broadband ARPU growth and further reduce residential subscriber churn rates. In addition, recent acquisitions have enhanced our ability to monetize premium content, cross promote and generate compelling cost synergies.

Subsubsection Title: Consolidate United Media as the leading media company in Southeastern Europe.
Subsubsection Text: Since inception, our strategy has been centered on differentiating our offering by producing superior and/or exclusive Pay-TV channels for our customers. We have applied this philosophy to all of our Group companies with great success, and we have created an attractive portfolio of full format national as well as specialized, thematic Pay-TV channels that we believe are a must have on all regional distribution platforms. Following the Vivacom Acquisition, with the integration of Vivacom and Nova BG into our operations, we are applying this philosophy in Bulgaria. We intend to continue to grow our content offering by further developing our portfolio of owned content, entering into strategic partnerships with third-party content owners and acquiring content owners, as in the past with the acquisition of Nova TV Croatia and Direct Media/Pink. Since inception, our strategy has been centered on differentiating our offering by producing superior and/or exclusive Pay-TV channels for our customers. We have applied this philosophy to all of our Group companies with great success, and we have created an attractive portfolio of full format national as well as specialized, thematic Pay-TV channels that we believe are a must have on all regional distribution platforms. Following the Vivacom Acquisition, with the integration of Vivacom and Nova BG into our operations, we are applying this philosophy in Bulgaria. We intend to continue to grow our content offering by further developing our portfolio of owned content, entering into strategic partnerships with third-party content owners and acquiring content owners, as in the past with the acquisition of Nova TV Croatia and Direct Media/Pink.

Subsubsection Title: Further expand our addressable market by utilizing our OTT platform and attractive content.
Subsubsection Text: Leveraging our strong brands and our attractive content, we intend to continue to develop our two OTT content platforms, our regional OTT platform, EON, and our international OTT platform, NetTV Plus, to ----- further expand our addressable market to areas outside our cable footprint. While our DTH Pay-TV platform aims to deliver our content to subscribers in rural areas in our markets without cable infrastructure, our regional OTT platform enables customers in metropolitan areas outside of our cable footprint, who have subscribed to the broadband internet services of our competitors, to access our attractive portfolio of Pay-TV channels and unique user interface and customer experience. Additionally, NetTV Plus allows us to provide over 200 local language channels showing ethnic content to the entire ex-Yugoslav diaspora around the world. By expanding our geographic reach outside of Southeastern Europe to customers in countries in Western Europe and North America, we believe that we are positioned to further increase our RGU base and earnings potential. We also plan to further invest in our in-house development of customer premises equipment, including OTT TV boxes for EON, which enables video streaming to customers’ TVs and allows us to offer services on competitors’ broadband networks. Leveraging our strong brands and our attractive content, we intend to continue to develop our two OTT content platforms, our regional OTT platform, EON, and our international OTT platform, NetTV Plus, to ----- further expand our addressable market to areas outside our cable footprint. While our DTH Pay-TV platform aims to deliver our content to subscribers in rural areas in our markets without cable infrastructure, our regional OTT platform enables customers in metropolitan areas outside of our cable footprint, who have subscribed to the broadband internet services of our competitors, to access our attractive portfolio of Pay-TV channels and unique user interface and customer experience. Additionally, NetTV Plus allows us to provide over 200 local language channels showing ethnic content to the entire ex-Yugoslav diaspora around the world. By expanding our geographic reach outside of Southeastern Europe to customers in countries in Western Europe and North America, we believe that we are positioned to further increase our RGU base and earnings potential. We also plan to further invest in our in-house development of customer premises equipment, including OTT TV boxes for EON, which enables video streaming to customers’ TVs and allows us to offer services on competitors’ broadband networks.

We seek to continue innovating and enhancing our product offering to further strengthen our leading position in Southeastern Europe. Our in-house technology innovation and software development center, United.Cloud, enables us to focus on leading the introduction of next generation television and broadband internet services by delivering to subscribers services such as EON (our next generation video delivery platform that includes linear and non-linear digital broadcasting, over 22,000 VoD assets, CatchUp TV, a Smart TV application for Samsung and LG and a multiscreen service for mobile, tablet and personal computer/laptop devices), UNIFON (our proprietary VoIP application connecting customers’ fixed-line telephones outside of their homes), our self-help application, enhanced TV features such as VoD and CatchUp TV services and many others. We will also continue to promote the digitalization of internal and external processes to improve customer satisfaction and profitability. In July 2020, we leveraged our position in both the broadband and Pay-TV markets to launch Shoppster, our regional e-commerce online-shopping platform, which will initially offer more than 20 popular product categories, including electronics, home and gardening, tools, fashion, items for children and kitchen appliances. We intend for Shoppster to deliver the simple, reliable and secure e-shopping experience that modern consumers expect. We seek to continue innovating and enhancing our product offering to further strengthen our leading position in Southeastern Europe. We will also continue to promote the digitalization of internal and external processes to improve customer satisfaction and profitability. We intend for Shoppster to deliver the simple, reliable and secure e-shopping experience that modern consumers expect.

Subsubsection Title: Continue to grow customer base and operations through value accretive acquisitions.
Subsubsection Text: We have a successful track record of making acquisitions on attractive terms and successfully integrating those acquisitions. Between 2011 and March 31, 2021, we have acquired and integrated (or are in the process of integrating) approximately 50 cable TV operators, content platforms, media companies, mobile service providers, B2B service providers and internet service providers (“ISPs”) in Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Greece, Croatia and Montenegro. We have also expanded our addressable market through the Vivacom Acquisition and Nova Broadcasting Group Acquisition (in Bulgaria), the Forthnet Acquisition (in Greece) and the Optima Telekom Acquisition (in Croatia), as well as various other recent acquisitions. Our acquisition strategy consists of expanding our scale in a value accretive manner, enhancing our content offering, expanding our fixed-line and mobile-telephony operations and leveraging our experience and successful acquisition history to continue to make acquisitions that allow us to generate additional value for our operations through increasing scale and product offerings. We plan to continue to make value accretive acquisitions at attractive multiples to integrate regional service providers, cable assets and fixed-line and mobile-telephony operators into the business, and we intend to continue taking a disciplined approach to acquisitions by assessing individual opportunities on the basis of merit, ability to integrate assets into our existing business plans and potential for value creation. We have a successful track record of making acquisitions on attractive terms and successfully integrating those acquisitions. Between 2011 and March 31, 2021, we have acquired and integrated (or are in the process of integrating) approximately 50 cable TV operators, content platforms, media companies, mobile service providers, B2B service providers and ISPs in Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Greece, Croatia and Montenegro. We have also expanded our addressable market through the Vivacom Acquisition and Nova Broadcasting Group Acquisition (in Bulgaria), the Forthnet Acquisition (in Greece) and the Optima Telekom Acquisition (in Croatia), as well as various other recent acquisitions. Our acquisition strategy consists of expanding our scale in a value accretive manner, enhancing our content offering, expanding our fixed-line and mobile-telephony operations and leveraging our experience and successful acquisition history to continue to make acquisitions that allow us to generate additional value for our operations through increasing scale and product offerings. We plan to continue to make value accretive acquisitions at attractive multiples to integrate regional service providers, cable assets and fixed-line and mobile-telephony operators into the business, and we intend to continue taking a disciplined approach to acquisitions by assessing individual opportunities on the basis of merit, ability to integrate assets into our existing business plans and potential for value creation.

Subsubsection Title: Continue to Focus on Environmental, Social and Corporate Governance (“ESG”) Matters
Subsubsection Text: We and our shareholders recognize that achieving a sustainable and responsible business that has a positive social impact will be key to our future success. As we have grown our Group, we have increased our emphasis on integrating ESG considerations into our decision-making and reporting processes. In 2020, we established a dedicated ESG coordinator role within the Group and finalized a detailed ESG action plan and implementation roadmap in consultation with external advisors. To promote environmental sustainability in our operations, we are taking active steps to minimize our environmental footprint, while also collecting and analyzing Group historical data to set future KPI targets for reductions in carbon emissions, climate change policy, energy use and energy sourcing. We have committed to the Science Based Targets initiative which helps to drive climate action in the private sector by enabling companies to set emissions reduction targets with scientific data. We are committed to reducing greenhouse gas emissions across our offices and infrastructure and we established a solar power plant in Slovenia in 2019 ----- with an annual production capacity of 254 kWh and have leveraged our experience in this project to look for additional green energy projects which could cover a significant part of our carbon emission footprint. In addition, we use electric vehicles in our operations where feasible, and we work to exchange old, less-energy efficient equipment for more energy-efficient devices. In 2020, we generated approximately 128.1 thousand tons of CO2 emissions (9.3 thousand tons of scope 1 emissions and 118.8 thousand tons of scope 2 and 3 emissions), including the contribution of acquired companies, and we intend to reduce these to approximately 50.6 thousand tons by 2030. In 2020, we recycled 1,539 tons of network telecom equipment, batteries, cables, paper and cardboard. We are also committed to minimizing waste and we repurpose, reuse or recycle 100% of returned customer devices and accessories. We actively support the communities in which we operate, and in 2020, we named a Group-level director for corporate social responsibility to coordinate efforts in this regard among our operating companies. We have as a Group donated €4.5 million in 2020 and €2.0 million for the twelve months ended March 31, 2021, to groups and activities dedicated to protecting the environment, education and the socially vulnerable, as well as other donations, such as donating personal protective equipment to help fight COVID-19. We have also engaged in multiple community engagement activities in the past few years, with a focus on using our platform to deliver knowledge to children (including programs for online safety), students, the general public and disadvantaged groups, by leveraging our core competencies in broadband internet and other telecommunications. For 2021, we aim to increase the percentage of staff participating in a community engagement activity (e.g., volunteering time or knowledge), which in 2020 stood at 7%. We focus on building a safe, fair and inclusive working environment for our employees. To inform our diversity, inclusion and safety targets, we collect data on our workforce, such as gender mix (55% male, 45% female), percentage of women in management positions (30%, including our Chief Executive Officer) and percentage of disabled employees (1%), in each case as of March 31, 2021. For the twelve months ended March 31, 2021, staff total turnover is 12% and we have experienced 50 workplace injury incidents. We also have mandated diversity and inclusion rules, and have documented these in employee manuals at our Group companies, which include, among others, statutory requirements related to workers’ rights and human rights (e.g., antidiscrimination and anti-mobbing) and annual employee Net Promoter Score (“eNPS”) measurements. To facilitate further transparency and accountability, we plan to expand our anonymous suggestion boxes already present in certain of our Group companies and establish whistle-blowing programs as a distinct transparency function. We also offer training programs to employees which are focused on improving job-related technical and management skills, as well as on compliance with our internal policies. Subsubsection Title: Continued focus on our competitive market position by leveraging our advanced network, differentiated content offerings and loyal customer base.
Increase service penetration across the region by cross-selling products and services and up selling value adding products to existing customers.
Consolidate United Media as the leading media company in Southeastern Europe.
Further expand our addressable market by utilizing our OTT platform and attractive content.
Continue to grow customer base and operations through value accretive acquisitions.
Continue to Focus on Environmental, Social and Corporate Governance (“ESG”) Matters

Subsubsection Text: Our goal is to strengthen our telecommunications and media leadership position in Southeastern Europe and to continue our strong growth momentum by successfully integrating Vivacom, Tele2 Croatia, Forthnet, Nova BG, Optima Telekom and other acquisitions and by leveraging our competitive strengths: well invested ----- fixed and mobile networks, differentiated content offerings and local production capabilities and a loyal customer base. Our focus is on continuing to provide our customers the best products and services in each of our segments and markets, including more innovative products and features, a superior customer experience and better value compared to competitors. In parallel, our goals are to continue to deliver exceptional revenue growth across segments (both organically and through strategic acquisitions) and capitalize on operating leverage and continued operating efficiencies to deliver strong profitability and cash flow growth. In order to achieve these goals, we have identified the following strategic pillars: Our goal is to strengthen our telecommunications and media leadership position in Southeastern Europe and to continue our strong growth momentum by successfully integrating Vivacom, Tele2 Croatia, Forthnet, Nova BG, Optima Telekom and other acquisitions and by leveraging our competitive strengths: well invested ----- fixed and mobile networks, differentiated content offerings and local production capabilities and a loyal customer base. Our focus is on continuing to provide our customers the best products and services in each of our segments and markets, including more innovative products and features, a superior customer experience and better value compared to competitors. In parallel, our goals are to continue to deliver exceptional revenue growth across segments (both organically and through strategic acquisitions) and capitalize on operating leverage and continued operating efficiencies to deliver strong profitability and cash flow growth.
