BC Partners is a leading global investment firm that is currently investing its eleventh flagship private equity fund. BC Partners has continually operated for over three decades, with beginnings in Europe and expanding to North America as a core focus more than a decade ago. They have invested from 11 successive funds totaling over €30 billion of committed capital, with 122 private equity investments representing €160 billion of transaction value completed across 18 countries. BC Partners operates across five core sectors including business & financial services, consumer & retail, industrials, healthcare and TMT and employs 66 private equity professionals operating from four offices: New York, London, Paris and Hamburg.

Subsubsection Title: COVID-19 Impact on Revenues and Adjusted EBITDA
Subsubsection Text: Based on our analysis, we estimate that the COVID-19 pandemic had a minimal impact of approximately 1-2% to organic consolidated revenues during 2020 as compared to 2019 and during the three months ended March 31, 2021 compared to the three months ended March 31, 2020. The revenue streams most negatively affected include advertising, media selling and mobile handsets sales. Following the COVID-19 outbreak in March 2020, we implemented cost optimization initiatives and managed our capital expenditure plans in response to the pandemic, but we did so in a way that would not hinder our ability for future growth and quality of services provided. Our telecommunications segments have continued to meet customers’ expectations on service level and our network operating centers have maintained normal service levels. Based on this, no significant change in our customer base occurred. As customers were unlikely or unable to easily migrate during the crisis, in 2020 we experienced somewhat lower gross adds and churn rates, with our operations normalizing during 2021. Organic revenues and UG Adjusted EBITDA in our telecommunications segment remained stable during 2020 compared to the previous year. ----- During the first waves of lockdowns imposed in response to the COVID-19 pandemic between March and May 2020, as an increasing number of people began to work or study remotely and spend significant amounts of time at home, we saw a significant increase in our voice and data traffic. In particular, over this period, our fixed data traffic increased at rates between 50% and 70%, while fixed voice traffic increased at rates between 50% and 85%, depending on the country. In addition, our mobile data and voice traffic increased at rates between 30% and 40%, depending on the country. To accommodate such higher customer demand, we increased capacity on network elements and interconnections. In our Media segment, we estimate that organic revenue in the segment declined by approximately 5-6% for the year ended December 31, 2020 compared to the previous year. This decline was due in part to the postponement of certain sporting events and a decline in advertising revenue, partially offset by a decline in relevant costs. Overall, supported by cost optimization efforts, UG Adjusted EBITDA in the Media segment remained broadly stable year on year prior to giving effect to the Nova Broadcasting Group Acquisition. During the three months ended March 31, 2021, we have seen levels of organic advertising increasing and surpassing pre-COVID levels. Throughout the pandemic, we have continued to grow the Group through acquisitions, completing the acquisitions of Tele2 Croatia (completed in March 2020), Vivacom (completed in July 2020), Forthnet (completed in November 2020) and Nova BG (completed in January 2021). The impact of COVID-19 on these acquired companies is similar to that of the Group’s existing telecommunications operations. The expected contribution of the acquired companies has not materially changed given the crisis and all such acquired companies are performing in line with or above our expectations.

On July 9, 2021, we announced that we signed an agreement to acquire a majority interest of 54.31% in Croatian telecom operation Optima Telekom, for an estimated purchase price of €85 million based on an enterprise value of HRK 639 million, from Hrvatski Telekom and Zagrebacka Banka. Optima Telekom offers a broad range of fixed broadband internet services to approximately 117 thousand subscribers and pay-TV services to approximately 57 thousand subscribers in Croatia. Completion of the Optima Telekom Acquisition is expected for the end of 2021 and is subject to customary conditions as well as the implementation of certain changes in the current Croatian telecommunication legislation relating to vertical integration between pay-TV broadcasters and distributors, and thus there can be no assurance that the acquisition will be completed by such expected date or at all. Once completed, the acquisition of Optima Telekomwill allow us to further expand our presence in the Croatian market enabling Telemach Croatia to offer a full range of telecommunication services, including pay-TV, through its existing infrastructure. Optima Telekom had estimated last two quarters annualized adjusted EBITDA for March 31, 2021 of €16.8 million. Following completion of the Optima TelekomAcquisition, we expect to be required to undertake a tender offer for the remaining shares of Optima Telekom not yet acquired.

On or about the Issue Date, the Company expects to receive additional commitments from certain lenders in respect of the Existing Revolving Credit Facility in an aggregate amount up to €75 million, increasing the total commitments under the Existing Revolving Credit Facility from €250 million up to €325 million.

Based on preliminary results from our unaudited management accounts for the two-month period ended May 31, 2021, and other information currently available, we estimate that our revenue for the two months ended May 31, 2021 will be between €309.2 million and €313.2 million, compared to €144.1 million for the corresponding period of 2020. Estimated revenue of United Group increased compared to the prior-year period due to the significant impacts of the Vivacom Acquisition, the Forthnet Acquisition and the Nova Broadcasting Group Acquisition, none of which were included in such prior-year period. We estimate that EBITDA for United Group for the two-month period ended May 31, 2021 (excluding any adjustments), will be between €131.7 million and €135.7 million compared to €62.0 million for the two-month period ended May 31, 2020. ----- Financial data in this “Recent Trading” section is based on our preliminary management accounts and has not been audited, reviewed or verified by our independent auditors, and you should not place undue reliance on it. During the course of our financial statement completion process for the six months ended June 30, 2021, and for the year ended December 31, 2021, we could identify items that would require adjustments to be made and which could affect the final results of operations and financial position for the periods described in this section. -----

Our founder and group executive chairman, Dragan Šolak, founded the company as a Serbian cable TV operator in 2000. Between 2001 and 2005, we grew our business by constructing an advanced cable network throughout Serbia. We also consolidated several sub-scale family owned cable operators and successfully integrated them into our business. We launched our DTH services, Total TV, in Serbia in 2006 and in Slovenia, Bosnia and Herzegovina and Montenegro in 2007 and expanded Total TV into Croatia in 2008 (divested in 2018) and North Macedonia in 2009. In 2007, we entered into a strategic alliance with Sport Klub, and we acquired a controlling stake in the Ultra family of Pay-TV channels in 2009. As a result of our strategic alliances, as well as the acquisition of local language television channels, we were among the first pay-TV providers in Southeastern Europe to provide localized regional and international content. In 2009, we acquired Telemach Slovenia, a leading triple-play provider in Slovenia, adding 160 thousand subscribers to our operations. During 2010, our consolidation of three cable pay-TV operators in Sarajevo, including KT Global Net, BH Cabel Net and ELOB, led to the formation of Telemach BH. In addition, over recent years we have amassed a comprehensive portfolio of owned pay-TV channels, covering sports, movies, news, music, general entertainment and children’s programming, through our United Media business, which we have grown through focused and consistent investment. We continue to leverage our position as the sole credible consolidator in the fragmented regional markets and have successfully acquired and integrated a number of businesses since 2010, including Maxtel in 2016, a local B2B internet provider in Slovenia, and Ikom in 2017, a cable operator in Serbia. In addition, following the acquisition of M kabl in 2016, a cable operator in Montenegro, we have further expanded our subscriber base in Montenegro. Following the liberalization of the fixed-line telephone markets in Bosnia and Herzegovina and Serbia in 2011 and 2012, respectively, we launched fixed-line telephony services in these two markets and, leveraging our existing cable pay-TV and broadband internet subscriber base, became the second-largest Serbian fixedline telephone services provider in June 2013. We also launched our MVNO services in Slovenia in late 2012 and became an MNO upon our acquisition of Tušmobil in 2015, which allowed us to provide quad-play ----- bundles (cable pay-TV, broadband internet, and fixed-line telephony and mobile-telephony services) to our subscribers in Slovenia, in addition to stand-alone mobile-telephony services. In July 2018, we acquired Nova TV d.d. from CME B.V. We believe this acquisition, which included several popular television channels in Croatia, is helping us create a strong mainstream media platform, which further differentiates our distribution platform, promotes our pay-TV channel portfolio, drives continued growth and creates a strong platform for additional bolt on, accretive acquisitions. In September 2018, we acquired Direct Media, a leading media buying agency in Serbia, which included Direct Media’s operations in Serbia, Montenegro, North Macedonia and Albania, as well as our terrestrial TV stations Pink BiH and Pink Montenegro, which have been rebranded Nova BH and Nova M, respectively. On March 3, 2020, we completed the acquisition of Tele2 Croatia, the third largest telecommunications operator in Croatia based on mobile revenues as of September 30, 2020. Tele2 Croatia seeks to offer the best value proposition in the Croatian mobile market, for example, through its offering of unlimited mobile services. Now trading as Telemach Croatia, the acquisition has enabled us to accelerate our growth and further diversify our operations. On July 31, 2020, we completed our acquisition of Vivacom, the market leading integrated telecommunications operator in Bulgaria (based on revenue for the year ended December 31, 2020) which offers both fixed and mobile telecommunications services, as well as broadcasting and satellite services, with a market share of 30% in Bulgaria by revenue as of December 31, 2019, according to the CRC. Expansion in Bulgaria increased our addressable market by approximately 35% in terms of population, and the addition of Vivacom’s subscriber base more than doubled our existing subscriber base. Vivacom’s size, including approximately three million mobile subscribers, 514 thousand fixed-telephony subscribers, 4 64 thousand fixed broadband subscribers and 489 thousand pay-TV subscribers, provides us with significant additional scale, compounding our existing leadership. We believe that the acquisition of Vivacom provides us with greater scale and increases business diversification, expands our reach, cements our position as the industry leader in Southeastern Europe and continues our growth. In September 2020, we completed the acquisition of a significant minority interest in Forthnet S.A., a prominent telecom operator and Pay-TV provider in Greece, and in November 2020, we acquired a controlling interest in Forthnet. Forthnet provides home entertainment and communications services to nearly 1.4 million RGUs. This marked our entry into the Greek market and strengthens our position as an industry leader in Southeastern Europe. Forthnet is the second-largest Pay-TV operator in Greece. The Forthnet Acquisition enables us to accelerate our growth and further diversify our Group In January 2021, we acquired Bulgaria’s largest multi-platform media company, Nova Broadcasting Group EOOD, providing a strong base for our content offering in Bulgaria. In July 2021, we signed an agreement to acquire a majority interest in Croatian telecommunication operator Optima Telekom. Optima Telekom offers a broad range of fixed broadband internet services to approximately 117 thousand subscribers and pay-TV services to approximately 57 thousand subscribers in Croatia. Upon completion, the Optima Telekom Acquisition will allow us to further expand our presence in the Croatian market enabling us to offer a full range of telecommunication services, including pay-TV, through our existing infrastructure.
We offer our subscribers a broad range of cable and satellite pay-TV, broadband internet and fixed-line and mobile-telephony services in the following categories: -----

Subsection Title: Cable and mobile International OTT DTH Media 6 core customer brands + A media franchise with several top brands
Subsubsection Text: SLO BH SRB BLG GRE MNE CRO GRE EON . SLO SRB BH MK MNE

We provide analog and digital cable pay-TV throughout our network in Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria and Montenegro. As of March 31, 2021, we provided our cable pay-TV services to 212 thousand subscribers in Slovenia through Telemach Slovenia (61% of homes passed), 736 thousand subscribers in Serbia through SBB Serbia (65% of homes passed), and 208 thousand subscribers in Bosnia and Herzegovina through Telemach BH (61% of homes passed). In Bulgaria, Vivacom offers DTH and IPTV services throughout the country. As of March 31, 2021, Vivacom provided pay-TV services to approximately 521 thousand subscribers in Bulgaria. Following completion of the Optima Telekom Acquisition, we will offer IPTV services to approximately 57 thousand subscribers in Croatia. In line with our business strategy, we leverage our extensive cable network and distinctive cable pay-TV content to encourage our subscribers to purchase one of our bundles, which offer the convenience of being able to receive television, broadband internet and telephony services from a single provider. As of March 31, 2021, approximately 82% of our cable pay-TV subscribers had purchased one of our bundles. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, our analog and digital cable pay-TV business segment generated revenues of €51.6 million and an average ARPU of €11.3. We offer high-quality analog and digital pay-TV throughout our network. All of our pay-TV customers receive our analog pay-TV service (“Basic TV”). Our Basic TV package has been standardized across our network ----- and offers customers access to over 54 analog TV channels in Serbia, over 15 in Slovenia, and over 54 in Bosnia and Herzegovina. In addition to Basic TV, we provide our customers with the option to subscribe to our digital cable pay-TV services (previously offered under our D3 brand and now offered under the EON brand of products and services), and we focus on migrating analog subscribers to digital services and on continuing to take advantage of the cross and up selling opportunities provided by an influx of potential new customers switching from analog to digital cable pay-TV. Our digital cable pay-TV service provides our customers with access to between 106 and 310 digital channels depending on the particular market, including up to approximately 88 HD channels and 162 radio stations. We offer channel line ups across a variety of popular genres, such as sports, children’s entertainment and movies. We believe our high-quality and broad channel and content offering allows us to take a distinctive position in the market as compared to our competitors. In July 2020, in cooperation with Bosnian operator Trion Tel, we started offering EON bundle packages in Republika Srpska (the Serbian part of Bosnia and Herzegovina), where we previously had no cable presence, through the GPON of Trion Tel. In addition to our bundles, we also offer our subscribers digital add on TV packages, each containing premium SD and HD television channels, such as HBO, as well as bundled VoD options for subscribers who have leased one of our digital receivers. Our digital cable pay-TV service also includes CatchUp TV and VoD services. CatchUp TV provides subscribers with the ability to view a wide variety of television programs from a group of popular channels at any time within seven days after the programs originally aired. VoD provides subscribers with access to a library of over 26,000 movies and other programming titles, either on a transactional basis or a monthly subscription contract. In 2012, we launched our TV everywhere applications (previously offered under the D3 Go brand name and now offered as one of our EON brand of products and services) for computer, tablet and mobile devices in 2012. Through these applications, we provide our existing cable pay-TV subscribers with access to our digital pay-TV content “on the go.”Our TV everywhere content is also available to our mobile subscribers in Slovenia over our mobile network. _Telemach Slovenia_ Our Pay-TV penetration in Slovenia was 61% as of March 31, 2021. Our number of cable Pay-TV subscribers in Slovenia increased was 212 thousand as of March 31, 2021. According to Fitch Solutions, in 2018, the total pay-TV market (which includes cable, IPTV and DTH subscribers) in Slovenia was estimated at 649 thousand subscribers compared to 259 thousand subscribers for Telemach Slovenia (including cable, IPTV and DTH subscribers) as of March 31, 2021, which we believe represents significant growth potential in the pay-TV market in Slovenia. As of March 31, 2021, 100% of our cable pay-TV customers are subscribed to digital TV. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, Telemach Slovenia’s cable pay-TV services generated revenues of €12.2 million and an ARPU of €18.0. _SBB Serbia_ Our pay-TV penetration in Serbia was 65% as of March 31, 2021, and our number of cable pay-TV subscribers in Serbia was 736 thousand as of March 31, 2021. According to Fitch Solutions, in 2018, the total pay-TV market (which includes cable, IPTV and DTH subscribers) in Serbia was estimated at 1.6 million subscribers compared to 963 thousand subscribers for SBB Serbia (including cable, IPTV and DTH subscribers) as of March 31, 2021, which we believe represents significant growth potential in the pay-TV market in Serbia. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, SBB Serbia’s cable pay-TV services generated revenues of €23.7 million and an ARPU of €10.5. _Telemach BH_ Our pay-TV penetration in Bosnia and Herzegovina was 61% as of March 31, 2021. Our number of cable pay-TV subscribers in Bosnia and Herzegovina was 208 thousand as of March 31, 2021. According to Fitch Solutions, in 2018, the total pay-TV market (which includes cable, IPTV and DTH subscribers) in Bosnia and Herzegovina was estimated at 817 thousand subscribers compared to 344 thousand subscribers for Telemach BH (including cable, IPTV and DTH subscribers) as of March 31, 2021, which we believe represents significant growth potential in the pay-TV market in Bosnia and Herzegovina. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, Telemach BH’s cable pay-TV services generated revenues of €6.9 million and an ARPU of €10.6. ----- _Telemach MNE_ We offer analog pay-TV throughout our network in Montenegro and our cable package has been standardized across our network. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, Telemach MNE’s cable pay-TV services generated revenues of €1.1 million and an ARPU of €11.5. _Vivacom_ Vivacom offers IPTV services throughout Bulgaria which includes attractive content and user friendly features. Vivacom’s had 290 thousand IPTV pay-TV subscribers as of March 31, 2021. Vivacom’s IPTV offering includes over 240 channels with more than 75 HD channels, as well as the corresponding equipment. The IPTV service includes interactive features, a “video on demand” library with more than 20,000 titles and an own movie channel called “VIVACOM Arena.” Vivacom has content distribution agreements in place with a number of major content providers and provides IPTV GO service to customers outside the area of coverage of its network in Bulgaria. Vivacom also offers mobile TV under its TV GO brand. Customers can choose between a mix of over 90 channels and sports content with DiemaXtra and MAX Sport Plus, or one or all of the VOD sections: VIVACOM’s MAXI, HBO On Demand and Disney English. Vivacom’s mobile subscribers can order any content available on TV GO directly on the recently updated application with a new UI/UX design. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, Vivacom’s cable pay-TV services generated revenues of €7.8 million, representing 24% of its fixed-line revenue for the same period. _Direct to Home Pay-TV_ Our DTH, or satellite, pay-TV service, known as Total TV, is targeted at households outside our cable footprint across Southeastern Europe. Since January 2018 we have not offered pay-TV services in Croatia, due to the divestiture of our Total TV operations in Croatia in connection with the Nova TV Croatia Acquisition. Following the acquisition of Forthnet, United Group also offers DTH pay-TV across Greece to approximately 313 thousand subscribers. Total TV provides subscribers with access to up to 122 channels in Serbia, 53 of which are also available in HD format, 126 channels in Slovenia, 49 of which are also available in HD format, and 129 channels in Bosnia and Herzegovina, 48 of which are also available in HD format. In Bulgaria, Vivacom offers DTH pay-TV with over 160 channels, 20 of which are in HD, as well as multi-feed with over 200 additional channels. In Greece, Forthnet offers DTH pay-TV under the Nova Sports, Nova Cinema and Nova Go brands, with 75 channels, 47 of which are in HD. As we only actively market our DTH offering in those areas that are outside our cable footprint, there is limited to no overlap with analog and digital cable Pay-TV offering. Additionally, there is a low risk of cable pay-TV cannibalization, due to the fact that, for a similar price as basic DTH pay-TV services, our basic cable pay-TV services offer a better value. As with our analog and digital cable pay-TV offering, customers can choose from a range of DTH packages across different price points. Additionally, we have entered into partnership agreements with Telekom Slovenije in Slovenia and Telekom Srbija in Serbia pursuant to which we offer DTH pay-TV content and re sell their respective ADSL internet services to customers outside of our cable footprint. As of March 31, 2021, we provided our Total TV services to approximately 992 thousand subscribers throughout Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Greece, North Macedonia and Montenegro. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, our DTH Pay-TV business segment generated revenues of €37.2 million and an ARPU of €12.4. _OTT Television_ Our two OTT content platforms: our regional OTT platform (previously branded as D3i, now operating under the EON brand) and our international OTT platform (NetTV Plus), have enabled us to further expand our reach: - Regional OTT. Our EON regional OTT platform enables customers of our broadband internet competitors within Serbia and Slovenia (but outside of our cable footprint) to access our distinctive digital content via the internet. Unlike our DTH pay-TV platform, which aims to deliver content to subscribers in rural areas without cable infrastructure, our regional OTT platform delivers pay-TV services to customers in metropolitan areas. By expanding our reach beyond the traditional cable footprint using a regional OTT platform, we are able to increase the number of subscribers to our pay-TV content. ----- - International OTT. Our NetTV Plus platform, which we launched in 2013, provides over 300 channels in SD, 73 channels in HD and 265 radio channels, of which more than 250 local language TV channels showing ethnic content, including all national free-to-air channel offering, to the entire Yugoslav diaspora (estimated at over 4 million people) around the world through the internet. As of December 31, 2020, we had 106 thousand NetTV Plus subscribers. Subscribers can access our NetTV Plus content through their TVs using a set-top box connected to the internet, “Smart TVs” that have built in internet functionality or by streaming content via internet enabled tablets, mobile devices and personal computers. By expanding our geographic reach outside our region to customers in affluent countries in Western Europe and North America, we are positioned to charge prices that are higher than the prices we are able to charge for our pay-TV services in our other markets in Southeastern Europe. - Forthnet OTT. Our own OTT content platform, which operates under the NOVA brand of products and services, Novago, Novaflix, Nova on Demand. Our regional OTT platform offers our customers within the region access to their digital Pay-TV channel offering. As a result, our NOVA subscribers can watch our digital Pay-TV channels on their TV screens, computers, tablets and mobile devices.

We offer broadband internet in Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Montenegro and Greece. Beginning in 2009, we upgraded our network to EuroDOCSIS 3.0, and our network is fully EuroDOCSIS 3.0 enabled. Our network offers our customers up to 1.6 Gbps download speeds. We believe that EuroDOCSIS 3.0 is superior to DSL and on par with the FttH services offered by our competitors. We currently provide internet download speeds that we believe compare favorably to the national average with our average recorded speeds being faster than that of the respective local incumbent by a factor of 2.7x in Slovenia, 1.5x in Serbia and 2.9x in Bosnia and Herzegovina, as of April 16, 2021. As our broadband internet operations provide us with very attractive margins due to little additional cost, we leverage our attractive pay-TV offering to sell broadband internet services to existing pay-TV customers. As a result, we do not sell our broadband internet services on a stand-alone basis and customers wishing to receive our broadband internet services must, at a minimum, subscribe to our analog Basic TV package. As of March 31, 2021, we provided our broadband internet service to approximately 1,396 thousand subscribers across Telemach Slovenia, SBB Serbia, Telemach BH, Vivacom Bulgaria and Telemach MNE. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, our broadband internet business generated revenues of €73.9 million and an ARPU of €9.6. In addition, we offer out-of-footprint internet services (broadband internet services provided through a thirdparty network) across Greece to approximately 528 thousand subscribers through Forthnet as of December 31, 2020. Following completion of the Optima Telekom Acquisition, we will offer boardband internet services to approximately 117 thousand subscribers in Croatia. _Telemach Slovenia_ Within Slovenia, in a large portion of our cable footprint, our competitors offer DSL services offered by competitors, and not fiber, enabling us to provide the fastest broadband speed available within those areas. Our EuroDOCSIS 3.0 enabled network allows us to compete effectively in the remainder of our cable footprint, which is covered by our competitors’FttH network as it can match speeds offered by FttH operators in these overbuilt areas. We only offer broadband in Slovenia as part of a double, triple, or quad-play package with our cable pay-TV subscriptions. We offer our subscribers several for broadband internet service options, varying in price according to download capacity and speed, and range from a minimum download speed of 50 Mbps to a maximum speed of up to 1,000 Mbps. As of March 31, 2021, Telemach Slovenia provided broadband internet to approximately 189 thousand subscribers. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, Telemach Slovenia’s broadband internet business generated revenues of €11.2 million and an ARPU of €18.2. According to Fitch Solutions, in 2018, the total broadband market (which includes cable, FttH, DSL and other subscribers) in Slovenia was estimated at 613 thousand subscribers compared to 189 thousand subscribers for Telemach Slovenia (including ADSL subscribers) as of March 31, 2021, which we believe represents significant growth potential in the broadband market in Slovenia. In 2018, cable-based broadband accounted for 29% of the broadband services in Slovenia based on number of households, while FttH, DSL and others (which primarily includes wireless, Ethernet, LAD and fixed wireless access) accounted for 71%. As of December 31, 2020, our total broadband market share in Slovenia ----- was 31%. Our fixed broadband penetration in Slovenia was 54% as of December 31, 2020 (estimated). As of December 31, 2020, 96% of our customers in Slovenia received broadband speeds greater than 70 Mbps. _SBB Serbia_ We are the leading cable broadband internet provider in Serbia with our network, passing approximately 1,137 thousand households across the country as of March 31, 2021. Within Serbia, our subscribers benefit from our extensive fully two way enabled and EuroDOCSIS 3.0 upgraded network, with our current maximum commercial offering speed of 1,024/50 Mbps. As of December 31, 2020, the minimum broadband delivery speed we offer to new customers is 75 Mbps. We believe this compares favorably to the minimum broadband internet delivery speed offered by our competitors in Serbia. We offer broadband in Serbia to our existing TV customers and increasingly as part of a multi-play package with our cable Pay-TV. We offer customers several options of broadband internet services varying in download capacity and speed at various price points. As of March 31, 2021, we provided broadband internet to approximately 537 thousand subscribers. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, SBB Serbia’s broadband internet business generated revenues of €19.8 million and an ARPU of €10.6. According to Fitch Solutions, in 2018, the total broadband market (which includes cable, FttH, DSL and other subscribers) in Serbia was estimated at 1.5 million subscribers compared to 537 thousand subscribers for SBB Serbia (including ADSL subscribers) as of March 31, 2021, which we believe represents significant growth potential in the broadband market in Serbia. In 2018, cable-based broadband accounted for 44% of the broadband services in Serbia based on number of households, while FttH, DSL and others (which primarily includes wireless, Ethernet, LAD and fixed wireless access) accounted for 56%. As of December 31, 2020, our total broadband market share in Serbia was 32%. Our fixed broadband penetration in Serbia was 47% as of December 31, 2020. As of December 31, 2020, 86% of our customers in Serbia received broadband speeds greater than 50 Mbps. _Telemach BH_ Within Bosnia and Herzegovina, our subscribers benefit from our fully two way enabled and EuroDOCSIS 3.0 upgraded network which extends approximately 4,591 kilometers across the country and allows network broadband internet speeds of up to 400/15 Mbps. We offer broadband in Bosnia and Herzegovina to our existing TV customers primarily as part of a multiplay package bundled with our digital cable pay-TV. Alternatively, we offer customers several tiers of broadband internet services with our analog TV service. These internet services are available with various download capacities and speeds and at varying price points. Higher broadband internet speeds are available when our internet services are purchased as part of a bundle with our digital pay-TV as compared to the internet services offered as a bundle with our analog pay-TV. As of March 31, 2021, we provided broadband internet to approximately 169 thousand subscribers. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, Telemach BH’s broadband internet business generated revenues of €5.6 million and an ARPU of €9.5. According to Fitch Solutions, in 2018, the total broadband market (which includes cable, FttH, DSL and other subscribers) in Bosnia and Herzegovina was estimated at 694 thousand subscribers compared to 169 thousand subscribers for Telemach BH as of March 31, 2021, which we believe represents significant growth potential in the broadband market in Bosnia and Herzegovina. In 2018, cable-based broadband accounted for 33% of the broadband services in Bosnia and Herzegovina based on number of households, while FttH, DSL and others (which primarily includes wireless, Ethernet, LAD and fixed wireless access) accounted for 67%. As of December 31, 2020, our total broadband market share in Bosnia and Herzegovina as of December 31, 2019 was 22%. Our fixed broadband penetration in Bosnia and Herzegovina was 49% as of December 31, 2020. As of December 31, 2020, 85% of our customers in Bosnia and Herzegovina received broadband speeds higher than 30 Mbps. While Bosnia and Herzegovina is generally not yet making use of high-speed broadband higher than or equal to 30 Mbps, we believe Bosnia and Herzegovina displays clear trends of acceleration. ----- _Telemach MNE_ Within Montenegro, our subscribers benefit from a fully two way enabled and EuroDOCSIS 3.0 upgraded network. We offer cable broadband internet in Montenegro to our existing TV customers primarily as part of a multi-play package with our digital cable pay-TV. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, Telemach MNE’s broadband internet business generated revenues of €0.6 million and an ARPU of €8.3. _Vivacom_ Vivacom provides an array of fixed broadband services over ADSL, VDSL and FTTx connections to both residential and business customers in Bulgaria as well as other data services such as the sale of CPEs, VPN and MAN services and associated complex solutions. All of Vivacom’s offerings include a variety of tariff plans to suit each subscriber’s usage levels. Vivacom has focused on the build out of its fiber network in targeted areas, the retention of its current ADSL subscriber base and migration to VDSL and FTTx and seeks to provide customers with comprehensive after sales services. Vivacom began its FTTx roll out in 2011 in Sofia and Varna and has since achieved significant progress, with 1,292 thousand fiber homes passed as of March 31, 2021. As of December 31, 2020, United Group’s total broadband market share in Bulgaria was 25%. Vivacom maintains a disciplined approach to expanding its fiber network in carefully selected areas and adhering to stringent project acceptance criteria. Vivacom believes its low build out costs are attributable to its ownership of the telecom ducts and the low-cost of labor in Bulgaria, allowing for an attractive return on investments in fiber. In addition, Vivacom bundles fixed-telephony and fixed broadband services, as its fixed broadband plan requires a fixed-telephony subscription and includes a free Wi Fi modem. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, Vivacom’s fixed broadband services generated revenues of €14.2 million and an ARPU of €5.2. Vivacom had approximately 476 thousand fixed broadband subscribers as of March 31, 2021.

We offer fixed-line telephony services in Serbia, Slovenia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria and Montenegro. We intend to leverage on our existing customer base and our extensive network and high-quality pay-TV content to cross-sell telephony products and bundled products to new and existing customers. Accordingly, other than in Bulgaria, our fixed-line telephony services are only available to our existing cable pay-TV customers. Through Forthnet, United Group also offers out-of-footprint telephony services (telephony provided through a third-party network) across Greece. According to Fitch Solutions, the total fixed-line telephony market in 2018 was estimated at 665 thousand subscribers in Slovenia, 2,430 thousand subscribers in Serbia and 740 thousand subscribers in Bosnia and Herzegovina. Since we had 191 thousand subscribers for Telemach Slovenia, 442 thousand subscribers for SBB Serbia and 105 thousand subscribers for Telemach BH, each as of March 31, 2021, we believe there is significant growth potential in such broadband markets. In Bulgaria, the total fixed-line telephony market in 2019 was estimated at 868 thousand subscribers (compared to 514 thousand subscribers for Vivacom as of March 31, 2021). The total fixed-line telephony market in 2020 was estimated at 4,852 thousand subscribers in Greece (compared to 536 thousand out-of-footprint subscribers for Forthnet as of March 31, 2021). Our “Basic Package”in Serbia, Slovenia, Bosnia and Herzegovina and Montenegro offers free calls within the Group network and only an analog touchtone phone is required to use our service. In addition to our Basic Package, we offer our subscribers various other packages, which include free calls to customers of other regional fixed-line telephony providers. Despite the relatively recent launch of our fixed-line telephony operations in Serbia, we believe it is the second-largest provider of fixed-line telephony services in Serbia behind the incumbent Telekom Srbija. We are the largest provider of fixed-line telephony operations in Bulgaria through Vivacom. As of March 31, 2021, we provided our fixed-line telephony services to 1,269 thousand subscribers (including Vivacom). For the three months ended March 31, 2021, our fixed-line telephony services generated revenues of €29.1 million and an ARPU of €4.3. -----

_Telemach Slovenia_ We provide mobile voice, messaging and data to consumers and small businesses on a contract and prepaid basis, together with an attractive suite of fixed mobile convergence services in Slovenia, which we believe has contributed to lower churn rates relative to our competitors. Since 2015, we have been the fastest growing mobile operator in Slovenia following our acquisition of Tušmobil. As a result of consistent growth, as of December 31, 2020, we hold a 24% market share in the Slovenian mobile market (as compared to 14% at the end of 2015) and cross-sell mobile services to more than 50% of our fixed-telephony subscriber base. Our growth over the last five years was largely underpinned by continuous investments in our mobile and fixedtelephony network. In August 2020, we received, for the second year in a row, the “Best in Test” award for both our mobile and fixed-telephony network by Umlaut (formerly P3 Group), an independent research agency. According to the Ipsos Brand Tracking Report 2017, our “top of mind” recognition as a mobile provider in Slovenia was 21% in 2017, but by September 2020, it had increased to 30%. Similarly, after the integration of Tušmobil, a higher percentage of customers chose Telemach Slovenia as their first choice for mobile products in Slovenia, while our primary competitors have experienced decreases or stagnation in this metric during the same period from 2017 to 2020. The following chart shows the evolution of customers’ first choice of brand:

(1) Product brands have been rolled out in Bulgaria and Greece as of the date of this offering memorandum. - Cable pay-TV. Our analog and digital cable pay-TV services provide our subscribers access to an attractive portfolio of standard definition (“SD”) and high definition (“HD”) pay-TV channels that offer popular local and regional content. As an additional service, we offer our pay-TV subscribers access to our proprietary pay-TV content “on the go” through our TV everywhere applications for computer, tablet and mobile devices. We offered cable and IPTV pay-TV services to approximately 1,479 thousand subscribers across Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria and Montenegro as of March 31, 2021, including 290 thousand subscribers through Vivacom. - DTH Pay-TV. Our DTH pay-TV service, known as Total TV, is targeted at households outside our cable footprint and, as of March 31, 2021, provides access to an attractive portfolio of channels to approximately 991 thousand subscribers across seven Southeastern European markets (Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Greece Montenegro and North Macedonia). In Greece, Forthnet operates a DTH Pay-TV service. - Regional OTT. Our regional OTT platform, which operates under the EON brand of products and services, allows us to reach customers of our broadband internet competitors and allows these customers to access our full digital pay-TV channel offering on their TVs, computers, tablets, mobile devices or other internet enabled platforms. Our regional OTT platform enables us to serve residents in Serbia and Slovenia who are currently outside of our cable footprint but have access to broadband internet connection with our pay-TV products. - International OTT. NetTV Plus is our OTT content platform which delivers a broad range of local and regional content to members of the entire former Yugoslav diaspora worldwide. NetTV Plus had 102 thousand subscribers as of March 31, 2021, indicating significant future growth opportunities, supported by the global proliferation of high-speed internet access, which makes OTT one of the most viable platforms to access ethnic content. - Broadband internet. We believe that we operate the largest broadband internet network in the region and deliver among the fastest broadband connections in our markets with speeds of up to 1.0 Gbps. Our network has been fully upgraded to EuroDOCSIS 3.0, which supports speeds of up to 1,200 Mbps. We offered broadband internet to approximately 1,396 thousand subscribers across Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria and Montenegro as of March 31, 2021, including 476 thousand subscribers through Vivacom. We offer out-of-footprint internet services (broadband internet services provided through a third-party network) across Greece to approximately 528 thousand subscribers through Forthnet as of December 31, 2020. Following completion of the Optima Telekom Acquisition, we will offer boardband internet services to approximately 117 thousand subscribers in Croatia. - Fixed-line Telephony. We offer telephony services using voice over internet protocol technology (“VoIP”), which allows our subscribers to make traditional fixed-line telephone calls using a standard telephone BLG ----- handset. We offered fixed-line telephony to approximately 1,269 thousand subscribers across Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria and Montenegro as of March 31, 2021, including 514 thousand subscribers through Vivacom. We also offer out-of-footprint telephony services (telephony services provided through a third-party network) across Greece to approximately 536 thousand subscribers through Forthnet as of March 31, 2021. - Mobile-telephony. We offer mobile-telephony services in Slovenia (through Telemach Slovenia) and Croatia (through Telemach Croatia), where we operate as an MNO in each country. Vivacom also offers mobiletelephony services in Bulgaria as an MNO. As an MNO, we are able to provide a broad array of subscription options, comprehensive data packages and enhanced coverage through our own mobile network. As of March 31, 2021, we offered mobile-telephony services to approximately 2,953 thousand subscribers in Bulgaria, 596 thousand subscribers in Slovenia and 923 thousand subscribers in Croatia. - United Media. Our media business produces several pay-TV channels across key genres and sells them to third-party pay-TV distribution platforms in the region. We also produce various TV formats which are then sold to free-to-air TV channels in the region. In addition, our media business provides advertising services and digital production and distribution. Since 2012, we have produced pay-TV channels across all genres, including entertainment, sports, news, eSports, kids, TV series and movies. We also partner with regional and international content owners who seek to provide their content in Southeastern Europe and have long-term contractual relationships with several of them. In addition, we offer attractive advertising services with desirable advertising slots which we sell to both local advertisers and clients from around the world. We have also established a digital music production and content distribution business, and in 2018, we bolstered our media business with the Nova TV Croatia Acquisition. In Greece, United Group acquired rights through Forthnet to offer compelling content such as sporting events, and Forthnet also offers content under its own Nova-branded channels and holds content rights through multi-year contracts with major international media companies such as Sony, MGM and Warner Bros. In Bulgaria, Nova BG holds rights to compelling content and also offers popular sports content such as English Premier League football and Formula One racing. - E-commerce. In July 2020, we leveraged our position in both the broadband and pay-TV markets to launch Shoppster, our regional e-commerce online-shopping platform, which will initially offer more than 20 popular product categories, including electronics, home and gardening, tools, fashion, items for children and kitchen appliances. Shoppster is available as an integrated online and TV shopping platform in Serbia and Slovenia. In Serbia, Shoppster operates as a marketplace using the dropshipping operating model, whereby it does not stock the products it sells. In Slovenia, Shoppster operates as a retailer as a result of an acquisition that we have completed and stores the products it sells in a leased warehouse. Products sold though Shoppster are distributed by third-party delivery couriers in both Serbia and Slovenia. Shoppster is a unique offering which combines the convenience of online-shopping with the audience engagement of television. Products will be presented and available for sale on the Shoppster TV channel, which will be devoted to home-shopping. Popular TV personalities from Southeastern Europe will present offers and products from the many companies that have joined Shoppster. We intend for Shoppster to deliver the simple, reliable and secure e-shopping experience that modern consumers expect.

Subsection Title: Customer first choice of brand evolution

Subsubsection Text: Through focused and consistent investment over the last few years, and by a combination of our investment in developing owned pay-TV content and in entering into strategic partnerships with regional and international ----- third-party content owners, we have built a comprehensive content offering, covering sports, movies, news and children’s content. _Owned Content Business_ Through our owned-content business we directly own many of the region’s popular pay-TV channels. In 2006, we acquired Sport Klub, the most popular sports channels in the region, and in 2012, we added Cinemania, a popular movie channel, to our content portfolio. We strive to continually improve these offerings. For example, in collaboration with notable studios in the United States, we have improved Cinemania’s movie content helping to establish Cinemania as a leading movie channel in the region. We have also continued to improve the content we offer through our leading Sport Klub channel by adding popular sporting events to its content portfolio. We have introduced localized feeds for Sport Klub channels, in both HD and SD. Furthermore, we organize and produce eSports events, which we broadcasts via Fortuna eSports. In April 2017, we acquired Fight Channel, a Croatian channel with premium content focused on Ultimate Fighting Championship, and IDJ Digital Holding Limited, a digital distributor of music and online video content in Malta. In 2014, we launched N1, an independent 24/7 regional news channel affiliated with CNN, with studios in Belgrade, Zagreb and Sarajevo and a large network of reporters and journalists reporting on regional events, and which is now available to subscribers in all of United Group’s geographic markets. In addition, we have sold distribution rights for this channel to all major operators in the region. In 2020, we signed an exclusive partnership with NewsMax International and launched NewsMax Adria, a 24/7 cable news channel. Since the beginning of 2015, we have utilized our majority stake in Grand Production, a leading Serbian music and TV production house with a long history of broadcasting popular shows in Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina and North Macedonia (formerly Macedonia) to introduce a 24/7 local music and entertainment channel called Grand. In 2016, we launched the Grand 2 channel, expanding our music channels portfolio with new content offered to our subscribers. In March 2021, we completed the acquisition of the remaining 49% of Grand Production. We have also been successful in broadening the distribution reach of our other pay-TV channels. For example, during 2015, we sold distribution rights for N1 and certain Grand Production channels to other major cable operators in the region. We have extended the distribution scope for Orlando Kids and Bambino (which have been rebranded as Pikaboo and Vavoom, respectively), popular channels geared towards children that complement our Ultra family of pay-TV channels, to include Bosnia and Herzegovina, North Macedonia, Montenegro and Serbia, as well as Croatia and Slovenia, where those offerings were already present. We have also increased revenues from our Sport Klub channels by successfully extending our existing contracts with third-party pay-TV distributors while maintaining access to premium content. We have also extended the production of the most popular entertainment shows for national TV stations in Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia, and North Macedonia, such as Your Face Sounds Familiar, Grand Stars, Never too Late and Practical Woman, which became among the most watched shows in their respective markets. In July 2018, we acquired Nova Croatia that features several popular television channels in Croatia. We believe this acquisition will help us to create a strong mainstream media platform that will further differentiate our distribution platform, promote our pay-TV channel portfolio, drive continued growth and create a strong platform for additional bolt-on, accretive acquisitions. In September 2018, we acquired Direct Media, a leading media-buying agency in Serbia, enabling us to deliver targeted solutions to advertisers, for both television (national and pay-TV) and digital, product placements and sponsorships. The transaction included Direct Media’s operations in Serbia, Montenegro, North Macedonia (formerly Macedonia) and Albania, as well as the company’s terrestrial TV stations Pink BiH and Pink Montenegro. In October 2018, we rebranded these channels as Nova BH and Nova M, respectively, to facilitate synergies with the existing brand equity of Nova in Croatia. In March 2019, we launched Nova S in Serbia, a channel fully exclusive to our SBB Serbia, Total TV and EON platforms. Nova S offers high-quality, locally produced series as well as sports and talk shows. Recently, we have significantly increased viewership in most of our channels, particularly Nova S, which has become one of the most popular TV channels in Serbia. In January 2021, we acquired Nova Broadcasting Group, Bulgaria’s largest multi-platform media company, which operates 10 television channels, including Nova TV, and Bulgaria’s largest online platform. Forthnet also produces its own media and content for the Greek market. We believe that the attractiveness of our content platform across key pay-TV genres supports the sustainable leadership position of our distribution platform. While a significant part of our content business’s revenue ----- consists of carriage fees charged to our own distribution platforms (Telemach Slovenia, SBB Serbia, Telemach BH and Total TV), we also generate revenues through carriage fees paid by third-party distribution platforms, such as Telekom Slovenije, Hrvatski Telekom, T2 and A1 (formerly Si.Mobil), sales of advertising and the sublicensing of some of the sports rights we acquire to regional free-to-air broadcasters or to TV operators in Kosovo, where the Group does not have any operations. Our Sport Klub sports TV channels are by far the most in-demand channels of its content business, followed by N1 and Nova S. The following table sets forth the main sports broadcasting rights United Group held through its TV channels as at December 31, 2020. United Group has historically been successful in renewing these contracts on comparable terms.

Tušmobil is the basis for 2015 data. Our mobile network provides coverage to almost all of Slovenia’s population through our extensive 2G/ 3G/4G and as of June 2021 5G networks. Licenses for use of spectrum for 2G are valid through 2031, while spectrum for 3G is valid through 2021 (5 MHz on the 2100 band), 2023 (another 5 MHz on the 2100 band) and 2031 (5 MHz on the 900 band). In 2016, Telemach acquired additional spectrum in the 1800 MHz and 2100 MHz bands. This acquired spectrum allowed United Group to expand our 3G and 4G networks. Use of frequencies in the LTE network currently includes 2x10 MHz in the 800 MHz spectrum band and 2x10 MHz in 1800 MHz spectrum band (which is the key spectrum band used for LTE services). These licenses are valid through 2029 (800 MHz) and 2031 (1800 MHz). We are capable of providing 4G (LTE) coverage to approximately 99% of the Slovenian population and 4G+ (LTE-A) coverage to approximately 98% of the Slovenian population. In addition, we have successfully tested and are rolling out next generation 5G networks across our mobile-telephony footprint. In April 2021, Telemach Slovenia secured 15-year spectrum licenses in Slovenia for 5G frequencies, and commenced deployment and commercial launch of 5G 3600 MHz in Slovenia in June 2021. As of March 31, 2021, we had 596 thousand subscribers for our post-paid and prepaid mobile services. During each month of the first three months of 2021, Telemach Slovenia achieved 34% of gross additions in the mobile market, as compared to 32% during each month of 2020 and 31% during each month of 2019. Our principal focus is post-paid subscribers, who generate significantly higher ARPU and generally have lower ----- churn rates than prepaid subscribers, and as of March 31, 2021, contract subscribers accounted for 83% of our subscriber base. According to Fitch Solutions, in 2018, the total mobile-telephony market in Slovenia was estimated at 2.5 million subscribers compared to 596 thousand subscribers for Telemach Slovenia as of March 31, 2021, which we believe represents significant growth potential in the mobile-telephony market in Slovenia. In April 2017, we updated our mobile packages, with more data, more calls and more text messaging, and introduced our UNIFI Travel Wi Fi roaming application, providing access to more than 70 million Wi Fi hotspots around the world. All products include free on net calls with unlimited off net national calls in medium and high end packages, and with the introduction of new EU roaming regulations which took effect on June 15, 2017, customers can now utilize their text message and voice minute allotments across the EU with no roaming charges. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, Telemach Slovenia’s mobile-telephony services generated revenues of €21.3 million and an ARPU of €10.9. _Telemach Croatia_ We provide mobile-telephony services in Croatia through Telemach Croatia, the third largest telecommunications operator in Croatia based on mobile revenues as of December 31, 2020, after Croatian Telekom and A1. In the post-paid mobile segment, Telemach Croatia seeks to offer the best value proposition in the Croatian mobile market, for example through its offering of unlimited mobile services. Telemach Croatia has an extensive 2G/3G/4G mobile network covering all major cities and important roads in Croatia. In February and March 2019, Telemach Croatia acquired 2100 MHz and 2600 MHz frequencies, enhancing spectrum capacity. Telemach Croatia is participating in a 5G spectrum auction in Croatia this year. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, our mobile-telephony services in Croatia generated revenues of €32.2 million and an ARPU of €12.1. _Vivacom_ Vivacom is among the market leaders in offering mobile services in Bulgaria. Vivacom offers mobile voice and data services and products over GSM/GPRS/EDGE and UMTS/HSPA+/LTE networks, on either a post-paid or pre-paid basis, through multiple volume based and flat rate offerings, each with multiple tariff options, and we believe that Vivacom’s mobile post-paid offerings are some of the most comprehensive in the Bulgarian telecommunications market. Vivacom offers other mobile services and products, including the sale of mobile handsets and accessories. Such services include unlimited mobile data, roaming voice and mobile data packages (within the European Union or within neighboring countries), SMS and MMS and international calls to both fixed and mobile lines. In all of its post-paid tariffs, Vivacom bundles mobile TV services under the TV GO brand with over 90 channels, as well as music streaming (Tidal) and cloud storage with mobile subscriptions. In addition, all of Vivacom’s customers have access to a digital wallet (Pay by VIVACOM) that is currently free of charge. On September 21, 2020, we announced the commercial launch of our 5G network in Bulgaria, and to that end in May 2021, we secured a 20-year license for 100 MHz spectrum frequencies in the 3.6 GHz band. Vivacom is also a leading provider of a full suite of telecommunications solutions for the corporate segment, with a portfolio of services suitable for all business sizes. All business mobile plans include national and international minutes, mobile data and a range of other features that support companies in running their businesses. For large business customers, the approach is to offer customized services tailored to their specific needs. For small and medium sized companies, we offer more standardized products, such as all-inclusive tariff plans that have a set amount of minutes (national and international) and data for a fixed monthly fee. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, Vivacom’s mobile operations generated revenues of €64.0 million, representing 49% of its total revenue in the same period. Vivacom had approximately 3.0 million mobile subscribers as of March 31, 2021, of which approximately 88% were post-paid subscribers and approximately 12% were pre-paid subscribers. For the three months ended March 31, 2021, blended mobile ARPU was €7.3.

. . . . . . . . 2016−2024 — — — — — — ✓ We secured regional rights for certain other major football and basketball competitions, including qualifiers for the FIFA World Cup and the Euro Cup, which were postponed to 2021 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. ----- The variety that we offer in our content business allows us to tailor our approach for each individual country and market in which we operate. We plan to continue to review our content offering and will continue to develop our own distinctive content. We continue to view content differentiation as the cornerstone of our strategy and to drive the attractiveness of our content offerings relative to those of our competitors. _Third-party Content_ In addition to our owned content offerings, our pay-TV distribution platforms typically license the rights for the distribution of our channels, as well as third-party owned channels, typically for a period of three to five years. As the prominent pan-regional operator, we have been able to negotiate contracts with third-party providers that we believe are beneficial. For example, we have been able to lock in flat-rate contracts for content that provide for terms spanning multiple years, which benefits our profit margins as our number of subscribers increases because we are able to retain the benefits of increases in our subscriber base, and thereby increase our margins. We also pay royalties based on our subscribers’ usage of our VoD content. We generally pay such license fees on a “per subscriber”basis. For on-demand content purchased by subscribers (transactional VoD), we generally pay a revenue share of the retail price. For packaged on-demand content, we pay on a “persubscriber”basis (subscription VoD), often subject to fixed minimum guarantees. If necessary, we also license third-party copyrights through various collective rights associations. We generally seek to negotiate fixed-fee contracts and attempt to move away from per- subscriber agreements. We expect that our content costs (above the minimum amounts) will generally increase in line with increased revenues from digital pay-TV and ondemand content and continued investment in high-quality content to differentiate our platform from our competitors. We negotiate our contracts for content and other third-party rights on a Group-wide basis, so that we are able to maximize the benefits of our scale and best practices across the Group, and we have historically been successful at renewing these contracts on comparable terms. We plan to acquire additional broadcasting rights in the future to further enhance our content offering. _Summary of Overall United Media Content_ The following table provides an overview of our content offerings:

Subsection Title: Series / Movies / Sports** **News** **Music** **Kids General Entertainment Channels
Subsubsection Text: Since 2011, we have been expanding our Wi Fi hotspot service in Serbia, Slovenia, and Bosnia and Herzegovina, and the service is currently offered under our UNIFI brand. To increase our brand recognition, we currently offer the service for free, and we believe that this product is steadily gaining significant popularity. We intend to utilize UNIFI to complement our bundled offering and reduce customer churn as well as to ----- incentivize the use of our products by potentially offering UNIFI free to only our subscribers. Moreover, we believe this service offers further monetization potential from users that are not our customers. In 2017, SBB Serbia and Telemach Slovenia launched UNIFI Travel, a Wi Fi service which is available in 120 countries, through more than 70 million hotspots. Telemach BH launched the same Wi Fi service in 2019.

Subsection Title: Series / Movies / Sports** **News** **Music** **Kids General Entertainment Channels
Subsubsection Text: One of our primary areas of focus is to provide bundled services, which consist of a package of two or more of the following services: pay-TV, broadband internet services, fixed-line telephony and mobile-telephony. This enables our customers to subscribe to these services in a convenient “one stop shop”manner at attractive prices that are lower when bundled than the sum of the stand-alone services of similar value. We believe that the several bundled options we have introduced allow our customers to tailor their packages according to their requirements and offer them greater value for money compared to similar services offered by our competitors. As of March 31, 2021, approximately 81% of our cable customers subscribed to our multi-play packages. In Bulgaria, Vivacom also offers multi-play service bundles and as of March 31, 2021, approximately 48% of Vivacom’s customers in Bulgaria are subscribed to a multi-play package. Our multi-play packages have allowed us to increase our total RGUs for cable-based services to approximately 10.6 million RGUs as of March 31, 2021. Our straightforward and unified triple-play offering, which includes pay television, broadband internet services and fixed-line telephony, accounts for a significant percentage of our total new sales, comprising 89% of our gross additions in Slovenia, 60% of our gross additions in Serbia, and 24% of our gross additions in Bosnia and Herzegovina, in each case for the three months ended March 31, 2021. Our best-selling triple-play packages (each based on the number of triple-play gross additions in the first three months of 2021) are: EON Light in Slovenia (accounting for 62% of triple-play gross additions in Slovenia); EON Full in Serbia (accounting for 47% of triple-play gross additions in Serbia); and EON Light in Bosnia and Herzegovina (accounting for 53% of triple-play gross additions in Bosnia and Herzegovina). We have upgraded our tripleplay offering consistently for both new and existing customers, which has allowed us to raise prices over time. The following chart compares our triple-play packages in Slovenia, Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina at the time of launch to the offerings as of March 31, 2021 with green colored fields indicating areas where our triple play package has offered increased value to customers since launch:

We utilize our existing fixed-line network in Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina and Montenegro to offer a range of business products including virtual private networks, Wi Fi hotspots, managed services and network capacity leases to telecommunications operators, financial institutions, public service customers and multinational companies. We are the first CISCO certified partner for B2B services in the region, and we aim ----- to continually improve the service portfolio of our business products by providing innovative and high-quality solutions along with dedicated customer care. We offer tailor made solutions for modern businesses across various industry segments, as well as to carrier clients. One of our key customers in the region is Telekom Austria. We provide network connection services for Telekom Austria’s mobile phone towers as well as ‘last mile’ connection services for Telekom Austria’s B2B clients. Other key international partners include Romtelecom, Tele2, Telia Company, Pantel Technologies, Inteliquent, Interoute, Level 3 and PCCW.

We sell our TV, broadband internet and fixed-line and mobile-telephony services, either on an individual service subscription basis or on a bundled basis, to residential customers and business customers. Our basic pay-TV subscription serves as a basis for cross-selling and up selling and, with the exception of subscribers in Slovenia who generally prefer to subscribe only to our mobile-telephony service, every subscriber needs at least a subscription for our basic pay-TV package to have access to our other services. Consumer subscriptions account for most of our revenues. Within the consumer market, we market our services directly to subscribers in single dwelling units and multi-dwelling units, such as apartment buildings. We provide our services pursuant to standard form fixed contracts lasting for 12 or 24 months. Our business subscribers typically purchase our broadband internet and voice and other data services, and we generally target small to mid-size businesses in metropolitan regions. Business subscriber contracts usually extend over a period of 24 months and cannot be prematurely cancelled free of charge. We believe that we have a loyal customer base, which is the result of low churn rates due to our high-quality content, extensive network coverage and high-quality customer service. Additionally, as our network covers the most affluent regions in Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, Croatia (following the completion of the Tele2 Croatia Acquisition), Bulgaria (following the completion of the Vivacom Acquisition) and Greece (following completion of the Forthnet Acquisition), our business benefits from low rates of services termination due to customers’ inability to pay.

United.Cloud is our technology innovation and software development center which we established in 2016 with offices in Serbia and Slovenia. The centralization of our research and development team within United.Cloud provides a significant improvement in time to market for our quality and innovative products, with a high degree of customization and flexibility to ensure new product launches are in line with our corporate strategy. We can create unified multi-service solutions to apply across all our markets, such as EON, with the ability to enter new markets quickly due to technological autonomy without a need to rely on outside developers, and our customers benefit from an improved user experience across our products. We regularly introduce new products and continue to develop our existing technology. Starting with D3 GO as a multiscreen option included in packages, we have added additional features such as UNIFON, UNIFI and UNIFI Travel. Our continuous focus on product innovation has led to a strong track record of in-house development, as shown in the following chart. -----

EON is our next generation video delivery platform that allows customers to watch their favorite channels on a range of devices, including set-top boxes smartphones, tablets, laptops, and Smart TVs, with the ability to seamlessly “hand off” and resume watching from one device to the next. EON is the first platform in the region to allow viewers to watch TV through an application on a Smart TV. In establishing EON, which developed out of the prior D3 platform, we have prioritized user customization, through the introduction of user inputs such as reminders, favorites and search functions. The home screen includes editorial content within a modern and intuitive user interface. The VoD component is extensive, with a CatchUp feature allowing viewers to access content broadcasted within the previous seven days, totaling over 15 thousand hours of content available at any given time. EON gives users access to over 502 TV channels, 163 radio channels, and more than 25,000 VoD assets. We have also ensured that EON utilizes the latest media encryption technology in order to protect against digital piracy. We have an additional stream of game changing updates to be introduced to EON over the next two years, including cloud DVR, “download to go” and improved connectivity with third-party devices and services. Our partnership with Google will help us release the 4K Ultra HD set-top box, which will fully integrate Google platforms such as YouTube and Google Play Store.

Our digital platform provides a sustainable channel to future proof our platforms and to address evolving customer habits around access to media, digital content and advertising consumption. _Telecommunications_ Our digital platform is an important element of our user experience, and we have recently focused on innovations in our self-help platform, web portals and e-commerce. Our self-help platform allows users to personalize their dashboards and access offers, pay their bills and receive assistance. We also utilize our web portals as a central hub for all marketing activity and offer access to support services and the ability to order products online. _Media_ We have grown our media content offerings on our digital platform. Our most successful digital media offerings are regional news and sport portals N1 and Sport Klub, as well as DNEVNIK.hr in Croatia and ----- Nova.rs in Serbia. N1 is a fully independent, stand-alone platform with automated content exchange. During the first three months of 2021, N1 had over 140 million page views, an increase of 9.5% compared to the same period in 2020, and over 20.6 million unique users (an increase of 29%) who spent approximately 2 minutes on average on the platform. In the same period, N1 recorded more than 41.8 million screen views on its mobile application. Our regional sports news platform, Sport Klub, is split across three separate web portals and a dedicated mobile application for iOS and Android. In the three months ended March 31, 2021, Sport Klub had over 4.2 million users, an increase of 29% compared to the same period in 2020, more than 20.8 million page views and over 7.8 million screen views on mobile devices. Launched on February 29, 2020, Nova.rs in Serbia is the latest portal in our portfolio. In a few months, it became one of the most influential portals in Serbia. As of March 31, 2021, the portal had 13.4 million users, 151.4 million page views and 71 million screen views on the application. In Croatia, our portal DNEVNIK.hr, with approximately 2,078 thousand real users in March 2021, an increase of 5% compared to the same period in 2020, is the most visited web portal in Croatia, according to Gemius ratings.

In July 2020, we leveraged our position in both the broadband and pay-TV markets to launch Shoppster, our regional e-commerce online-shopping platform, which will initially offer more than 20 popular product categories, including electronics, home and gardening, tools, fashion, items for children and kitchen appliances. Shoppster is available as an integrated online and TV shopping platform in Serbia and Slovenia. In Serbia, Shoppster operates as a marketplace using the dropshipping operating model, whereby it does not stock the products it sells. In Slovenia, Shoppster operates as a retailer as a result of an acquisition that we have completed and stores the products it sells in a leased warehouse. Products sold though Shoppster are distributed by third-party delivery couriers in both Serbia and Slovenia. Shoppster is a unique offering which combines the convenience of online-shopping with the audience engagement of television. Products will be presented and available for sale on the Shoppster TV channel, which will be devoted to home-shopping. Popular TV personalities from Southeastern Europe will present offers and products from the many companies that have joined Shoppster. We intend for Shoppster to deliver the simple, reliable and secure e-shopping experience that modern consumers expect.

service (3 days) We also continue to invest in our network infrastructure. For example, Slovenia is a GIGA country. Novi Sad, Subotica and Gornji Milanovac in Serbia are GIGA cities, while our plans for Belgrade are nearly complete, with Kragujevac in Serbia planned to be next. Sarajevo in Bosnia and Herzegovina is planned to be a GIGA city in 2021.

Along with content differentiation, customer service is a key pillar of our offering, and we believe that we offer subscribers high-quality customer service that is in line with Western European standards. Our customer service operations are responsible for all customer care activities, including technical support as well as handling queries and complaints from our customers. We operate dedicated customer contact centers in Ljubljana, Belgrade, Sarajevo, Podgorica, Sofia and Pleven. As of March 31, 2021, our customer service team employed approximately 837 employees (793 full-time equivalent). Vivacom also provides an additional service to high-value business customers who require proactive technical support. In addition to call center services, customers also have at their disposal a variety of self-service channels, such as an interactive voice response system, Unstructured Supplementary Service Data on Vivacom’s mobile network and the My Vivacom application, which was launched in 2018, and provides customers with 24/7 access to information about their services, customer data and current consumption, and notifications as to billing information. Forthnet also provides customer services to its customers in Greece. All customer service agents are regularly trained in soft skills and educated on new product offerings and advertising campaigns. As is common in Western Europe, we constantly measure our team’s response times and offer our subscribers the option to provide feedback on our service immediately following the call. Additionally, we have a customer service team focusing on business retention, which reaches out to existing subscribers prior to the expiration of such subscribers’ service contracts to extend the service contract and advertise our products through various initiatives, including, for example, Vivacom’s provision of mobile handset and tablet subsidies in order to grow its mobile subscriber base and complimentary installations for certain business customers. We also have a specialized team for sales and customer care in relation to our business services. We believe our customer service representatives are trained in accordance with Western European customer service standards, and we receive consistently high scores in our subscriber satisfaction surveys.

Our marketing, sales and customer care department is responsible for designing and promoting new products and services to customers, as well as building a high-quality customer experience throughout the entire “life ----- cycle” of a customer relationship. In this regard, we are able to leverage our owned content channels to cross promote our other products and services to our customers, because we can advertise those other products and services on our channels. We also market and sell our products using a broad range of sales outlets, including through our leased retail stores which are located in attractive parts of town in our key regions and markets, including in Ljubljana, Belgrade, Sarajevo and Sofia, third-party stores, telesales and our partners’ websites. As of March 31, 2021, our marketing, sales and customer care teams comprised 5,070 employees (4,555 full-time equivalent). To strengthen our brand recognition, we have entered into a number of sponsorship agreements with local, regional and national sports associations. Additionally, we give donations to social institutions, such as youth organizations, across the region. Vivacom works to provide a consistent image as a provider of “best in class”services and customer experience and high-quality subscriber experience in the key areas that subscribers value. Vivacom markets its products primarily through focused television advertising, with billboards, press, radio and the internet as additional advertising outlets. Vivacom sells services and products through direct channels, such as Vivacom owned stores and indirect channels and a smaller number of third-party retail distributors. Its distribution network is further supported by remote channels such as e-commerce platforms. To strengthen its brand image, Vivacom partners with well-known mobile handset brands, and in 2020, Vivacom launched its official partnership with Apple.

We employ a variety of network technologies to deliver our products and services to our customers, and the following chart provides an overview of our network technologies as well as the markets in which such network technologies are currently deployed. Approximately 92% of our core network to be DOCSIS 3.1 was ready by June 30, 2021.

Fully invested network with industry leading node density. 3.78 Million HH, ~73% capable for Gbps speeds The largest in the region Fibre network of 48 000 km for own and wholesale connectivity business Fully two-way 862 MHz DOCSIS 3.0, being in the process of being upgraded to 1 GHz (89%) and 91% of footprint is DOCSIS 3.1 ready OTT expands our reach to subscribers in areas outside of our Cable footprint as well as the entire ex-Yugoslav expatriate community around the world Well established CDN serving 1 M+ subscribers with 1,05 Tbps peak throughput Technology edge video interactive features New Greenfield HP’s deployment is XGS/GPON Unified services on GPON and HFC footprint XGS overlay on active Ethernet footprint in Bulgaria from 2020.
